Reviews.Title: “usual travelodge standards”
Reviews.Author: adaviesFromWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on the weekend of 17th March because of its location as we were visiting the o2.... check in was easy, the rooms are the usual standard of a travelodge - clean but basic, you have tea and coffee making facilities, tv and very thin pillows.... breakfast is fine, cereal, fruit, cooked items, pastries and nice coffee etc... it is ideal if you are visiting the o2 as it is just two stops with one simple change on the tube away... my only gripe with the hotel is that even though there may be people sat in the bar area drinking there is no staff there when you want serving.... 4 times I had to go to reception and ask them to send someone, and inbetween this, other customers had to go and ask after standing waiting around to be served also.... when there was only 6 of us in there I could 'possibly' understand the decision of not having staff there but when there was at least 30 sat in the bar it just doesnt make sense....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Angalina
Reviews.Content: We arrived in London ar Kings Cross, we purchased a day ticket for each day we were there for the tube as we found to get to the Dockland it take 3 - 4 tubes all depends on how you hit on with the tubes £7.00 a day ticket great value as you can go every where on the tube. We arrived at the India that is the tube station to get off for the travelodge. You will need to go down one flight of stairs and cross over the bridge that is above a very busy main road. If you cannot managed the stairs then you may use the lift at the tube station. We walked over the bridge then it is down a flight of stairs and walk past a monument on your right and straight ahead it looks like a dead end, with metal railings but keep going and you will see a gate opening, go through that and around the corner and there is the travelodge. I would like to add before we arrived, I rang the lodge to see if we could split our two nights up one at Doclands and one in London. I was informed to ring reservation, when I rang were not open. We booked in, I asked could we have one night here and one in central London, I was told to ring Superbreaks, as this is who it was booked with, (we did not book this break, it was a gift) we were informed of our room first floor as we walked up stained carpets, walls all needed painting you could smell airf resher had been sprayed, not good. The carpets need to be lifted up and new ones laid and all walls painted and new doors. (There is a lift here if you require to use it). We walked along the corridor, doors all marked more staines, I was dreading it, opened the door, yes basic, staines on the carpet everywhere, sick staines, needed painting and a good clean only on bath towel in the room bathroom not clean, quilt cover as not an off white, settee stained, I sat on the chair (plastic) only thing I would sit on whilst the kettle was boiling, looked at the bed and could see a large mark but not on the cover, stripped the cover off to find what looked like a large blood stain. I could not sleep in the bed, I looked at other hotels immediatley to move out, but so expensive, I ended up sleeping in the plastic chair for my two nights. Could not wait to get home to my own home comforts. The lodge has a bar, and breafast is served for I think £7.99 we did not take this up, there is nothing around you no other pubs or eating places that we found. We plan to go back to London, but we will book everything ourselves and stay in central London. Too many tubes to think about getting to the Docklands and we would never go back to the Travel lodge again. (Staff did not even say good morning when you past the staff on a morning) The big bus to go around London is £27.00 you can get on and off as many times as you like, a free river cruise is included well worth it about two hours for the river you may want to allow. So much to see and we could not do it all in two days, people in London who we spoke to we general freindly could not fault them really. We went to a show at Victoria Palace which is right outside Victoria tube staion a toddle we thought, tubes are every two minuets brill service could not fault it. We left the show half way through as we were not sure, if we stayed till the end would we be too late for connections back to lodge. Coffee shops are a huge business in London, Beer is approx. £3.75 a pint, I do not drink so it was £2.00 for a soft drink it will depend on where you go. Looking now to go back, we did go to Harrods, well you have too don't you.... what a fab shop door men (In Green Outfits) really helpful could not fault any of the staff, we came into contact with.. Perfect. We had a coffee across the road from Harrods, we sat out side, the coffee was very nice and £3.66 a coffee, watching people coming and going to Harrods it was nice to people watch.

Reviews.Title: “very bad location, slow receptionists and miserable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Yavor
Reviews.Content: You should never book this hotel! Hard to find, far away from everything actually. The only guests were some constructions workers, the receptionists were slow like hell, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: Jazzigirl
Reviews.Content: We were here a year ago when we visited the O2 to be in the audience for "Young Voices". I "speak as I find" so this review is at it happened to us. We had no problem finding the place as we had printed out a map before we left home. Check-in was by a charming young lady. Our room was on the ground floor this time, much better, as we did not have to rely on a lift. One small gripe was that I had to return to reception to get enough towels for two of us. Why when you book a room for two are there only towels for one? I can answer that for myself of course!! The bed was comfortable, it was very quiet and we had a good breakfast the next morning with helpful staff on duty. At £63.25, including breakfast, it was not a bargain compared to what I see others have paid, but for London we were quite satisfied. If we need to be in the area again we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: danharr
Reviews.Content: For Â£15 wasnt expecting much, but this hotel was great. Abit of travel involved but wasnt long. We had no idea how to get there from the tube (east india), but people were friendly and helped.Got to the hotel in 5 mintues from the tube, and used the cumputer there to check-in in less than 5 mintues. Room was big and both bed and sofa bed comfortable for just one night. Only reason not given it 5* is had a bad experience with others staying there at 3am, staff was helpful and sorted them out. fault-less :)

Reviews.Title: “Let down by the brand, made an experience by the staff”
Reviews.Author: deank
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Got the dlr and no sinage hen getting off the tube to find the hotel. Check in was good. A twin room means a family room, one 6ft 4 36 yr old man and a 75 yr old lady. Our fault or superbreaks but I had an uncomfortable sleep. No bath plug for the bath nor a tv control for the tv.! Dated room, bathroom towels damp ln arrival. Public areas looking tired and so are the rooms. On a real positive the staff look and seem happy. Every member of staff seemed to respond well to requests and acted quickly to sort problems out. Breakfast. This morning was lovely for a travel lodge. Well cooked and hot. Staff making sure you were happy and clearing tables and. Making that all important enjoyment check. The place is tired but the staff make up for it. D

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Given some of the 'lukewarm' reviews we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. First the negatives. The hotel location is out of the central London, but a reasonable journey on the DLR. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the East India DLR Station. On the first night of our stay a bunch of noisy revellers disturbed the peace and sleep for a while, but this thankfully was not repeated on Nights 2 and 3 of our 3-night stay. The positives included clean room; good shower; comfortable bed and helpful staff. We had a discounted room purchased in a Travelodge room sale. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: Cultured_family
Reviews.Content: Convenient to get to and somewhere cheap to park. Easy to get into London

Reviews.Title: “For Â£15.00 a night, perfectly acceptable BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: ju123
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Travelodge Docklands last night for one night as we were going to a gig in London. Although this hotel was nowhere near the gig venue (which was in Camden) for the price of Â£15.00 it was far and away the best value in London even amongst the other Travelodge's in the area. It was also convenient as were coming in by train to Stratford and it really is easy to get to this hotel from Stratford. The hotel is literally 3-4 minutes from East India DLR. To avoid confusion, take the footpath across the main road and continue to walk straight. You will see some security gates blocking the road but there is still pedestrian access and the Travelodge is through there. Contrary to previous reviews there is a signpost showing 'Hotel' within East India Docks but I can see why people have found it difficult to find. The hotel itself looks new and modern from the outside fitting in well with the rest of the developments in the area. Unfortunately, the much touted self check in machines were not working so we had to queue for five minutes to be checked in by Reception, staff were efficient if not exactly pleased to see us. We were on the ground floor in room 4. The room was standard Travelodge. We have stayed in many and we expect little more than a clean and functional room, this ticked all the boxes and as an added bonus we got an extremely powerful shower to boot. The bed was above average for the chain and we even managed to get an extra pillow for the room after the gig from Reception. The guy on the front desk was a little happier and wished us a pleasant night. Now the but.... After getting to sleep at 12.30am we wanted a decent nights sleep and more importantly a nice lay in. After all check out is not until 12pm at Travelodge. To our astonishment at 9am, with both of us sound asleep, we were rudely woken by a maid (we assume it was a maid anyway) who tapped on our door with a keycard and then proceeded to enter the room, despite the 'do not disturb' sign being on the door. After I shouted, the 'maid' closed the door and without a word of apology continued up the corridor doing exactly the same with other doors in our corridor. I find this behaviour totally unacceptable, even at a budget property. If I had been a) awake and b) at least partly dressed I would have confronted the 'maid' but I think I had made my feelings known in no uncertain terms anyway. On checkout I had hoped to discuss this with Reception but typically nobody was on the desk and despite ringing the bell for attention still nobody came to help. I am giving this a 3* rating as it is a fine Travelodge, not the best I have stayed in but certainly better than some of the worst. However, the experience with the unauthorised entry really did take the shine off our stay but as long as this is/was an isolated instance there is some serious value to be had by staying here. I would recommend it for anybody staying in London for a short trip as it really isn't far on the DLR into Bank but it is probably more suited for gig goers at the O2, or even people wishing to see the Olympic sites and shop at the Westfied Shopping Centre in Stratford. For Â£15 a night, it really cannot be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for O2!”
Reviews.Author: emylou123
Reviews.Content: This is another bog standard travelodge, clean, comfortable, dont expect too much...Good location for the O2 and DLR, but not too easy to find, its kind of hidden away with no signs...all in all, a pleasant stay and fairly cheap. You get what you pay for....

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jag308
Reviews.Content: Only paid 35 pound for a Saturday night stay. So I can not complain about any thing, I was warm,dry and had a bathroom. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sandra J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently as my grandaughter was in a singing competition at the Indigo2 and it was only 10 minutes away in a taxi. We weren't expecting to find such a clean and comfortable stay, as it was so inexpensive. The rooms were pleasant, very clean and comfortable. The staff were all very nice, polite, and extremely helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. There was a good choice of food for breakfast and it was enjoyable. I would certainly stay here again and would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: mitsy58
Reviews.Content: following some of the reviews we were apprehensive about our discounted stay here for 2 nights, but have no complaints about our stay at all. The staff were pleasant & helpful - when we reported a missing light bulb the manager came up immediately with a new one. Breakfast was one of the better Travelodge offerings. The room was clean, tidy, cleaned each day, quiet despite being next to the A13 & the location is excellent - DLR, Jubilee line & buses all a short walk away. The real bonus though is the parking - @ Â£5/day it is unmatched anywhere else in London, we next stayed in Norwich where parking cost us Â£14 for overnight only. It is also just outside the congestion zone - another plus. I would not hesitate in returning to this Travelodge on our next visit to London - a bargain in terms of location & price.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the manager?!”
Reviews.Author: jennyc702
Reviews.Content: The most apalling hotel I have ever stayed in. Although the basics are fine, comfortable bed, excellent shower, there is a complete lack of management. I lost track of the number of times in my 11 night stay that I complained about the poor cleaning - the bed was not made properly, the floor was not vacuumed etc etc. The food (unfortunately I had booked breakfast in advance) was beyond belief - powdered egg!! The bathroom door had been broken and would not shut properly as the toilet is in there that has got to be one for health and safety!

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: Gondolier
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here previously and new that ther was good transport links into the city. We stayed over the New Year. The room we had was not the best, the extractor fan did not work in the bathroom, therefore once we had finished having our showers the whole room became a sauna. Apart from this everything else was ok, the bed was comfy and we slept well. We cant coment on other facilities as we did not use them. Parking at the hotel was charged at a discounted Â£5 per day.

Reviews.Title: “great room and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hollywood7771
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel because it was easy access to the o2. the staff were helpful and attentive. our rooms were spotless and had plenty of towels and spare bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Knickers to breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights starting 5th - 8th January on a family theatre Break booked through Superbreak. First of all let me start with the plus points - the breakfast was tasty, the staff were friendly and the family room was a decent size. However.............................. The beds were the hardest, most basic, that for the first time ever I asked to change rooms, but due to a large damp patch on the ceiling and a musty smell, we decided to stay in our original one. On the first night the beds were not made. Despite there being, 2 adults and 2 children, only 2 sets of towels were given - although more were given on request. Due to a mix up with Superbreak, our rooms had been booked for the wrong date - luckily I had my paperwork and we were still allowed to stay, but our room key kept locking us out and we had to get it reactivated every evening at reception. But the biggest minus by far, was at breakfast on the second morning of our stay, now this being a Travelodge I didn't expect a dress code, but did expect a 'get dressed' code. A group of 4 girls came down to breakfast in their pyjamas - correction 3 were in their pyjamas and the 4th in underwear. I thought this was very unsuitable for a family hotel and was amazed to see this, however, the following morning when they were once more allowed in dressed the same way - I was absolutely astounded. I think that the management should have shown some respect to the other paying guests.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: mayz_one
Reviews.Content: You cant expect 5 star when you stay at travelodge. Glad it was only for 1 night as the hotel does need some serious refurbishing. Didnt have breakfast as we got our own with us as we were looking for a one night stay over. The road is busy outside, car parking is not free.

Reviews.Title: “good basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: jebuc
Reviews.Content: went as a couple between christmas and new year. Room was big and comfortable . We got a good night`s sleep. All towels and bed linen there Breakfast was good and filled us up for the day . It`s near to the DLR and the parking is cheap . Bearing in mind the price , I do not think you can complain. Only gripe is that you have to queue for breakfast if you get up after 8.30. Will go back there

Reviews.Title: “Basic & Cheap”
Reviews.Author: handydad
Reviews.Content: Spent a two night stay here, used as a base for sight seeing & theaters, very close to East India DLR, about 30 mins to the West End. Hotel Staff helpful but not well trained, don't bother to pre book anything, as this seems to add to the general confusion of the staff.Hotel bedrooms ok, might be time to invest in new beds etc. Report any problems straight away as it needs to be past down the chain of command which takes longer than resolving any minor faults.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the O2 - Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Essex_88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here late December as I had tickets to see Rihanna at the O2 arena. The hotel is at most a 5 minute walk from East India DLR station. We paid Â£10 to check in early so we could ditch our bags and head into central London. The room on our arrival was fairly clean, not the cleanest room i've ever stayed in but otherwise ok. There was only one big towel and one hand towel in the bathroom which wasn't ideal. There was also only one tiny bar of soap in the way of amenities in the room as well as tea making facilities. We did notice some noise from aircraft from London City airport but it didn't stop us from getting a fairly good nights sleep. One quite annoying flaw was the pillows, you get on each and they were literally as flat as a pancake. Breakfast was absolutely dire and I would not recommend paying for it. It was around Â£7 per person and you can get a much better breakfast elsewhere. The hotel was only 2 stops from the O2 so it is ideal location wise. I'd recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and visiting the O2 but don't expect the ritz, it is basic accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Municipal - like a terrible hospital”
Reviews.Author: ShanThorn
Reviews.Content: Cold room, dirty stained carpet , cheap and nasty mattresses and towels .......if we did not have to get to O2 we would have left!

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the O2, but basic”
Reviews.Author: T55MCS
Reviews.Content: So let's be clear, this is a budget hotel. No frills like toiletries, no phone in the room, cell block decor. However for Â£59 for a room to crash after an event at the O2 it was good value. It is located a short walk from East India DLR station, and if you have a room overlooking the carpark it's reasonably quiet. Don't expect much in the way of customer service, the check in desk is pretty busy and staff seemed under pressure. Although the hotel looks very tired and really needs a coat of paint, it is clean in the bedrooms and the bathroom. The overall comfort of the room is acceptable, but it doesn't feel like much consideration has been given to this aspect of your stay. I would use this hotel again because it is exceptionally good value and the location is perfect for the O2, but I really hope they listen to the feedback about the need for a refurbishment. It's over due!

Reviews.Title: “Not far from city center”
Reviews.Author: slawekg07
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated not far from city center , close to DLR station with parking next to hotel. Typical standard for Travelodge.Hotel is not very old and clean. There is a kettle in the room. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Guest - Very Tired. Hotel - Very tired too!”
Reviews.Author: PROLLAND
Reviews.Content: This is an hotel located in the perfect position for visiting central London without having to worry about the Congestion Charge. Parking is plentiful albeit on a first come, first served basis. The Docklands Light Railway is less that 200 metres walk away (East India) providing direct access to the City and onwards to the Underground network. Fantastically convenient! A warm welcome was received at reception and our request for a quiet room away from the busy main road was accommodated without a problem. Unfortunately, the room was awful. The double glazed window did not close properly so noise intrusion was constant. Decoration was shabby and stained and the bed - what can one say. Not only was there a huge dip in the middle but the divan base was clearly on its last legs as it groaned every time we turned over. Regrettably it was after midnight before we went to bed so it was far too late to change rooms. The problem was reported to Reception when we left the next morning and we were told that our complaint would be passed to the maintenance department. No offer of a refund, even a partial one however. Breakfast, which we had pre-booked on-line was OK but avoid the only choice of eggs - scrambled - as you could use them to build walls. Everything else was fine. We did not eat in the restaurant bar before going to our show in town as we had a dinner reservation elsewhere. However, when we returned to the hotel just before midnight, we were surprised and pleased that the bar was till open and would remain so until 1.30 am! In summary - excellent location, mediocre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the O2 and its cheap !”
Reviews.Author: wesley j
Reviews.Content: Ok - so i read some of the reviews on here and i was very nervous about staying here. Firstly lets put things into some perspective. I needed a hotel near the O2 that was easy to get back to after an event and wasn't too expensive. I got a good deal on this buget hotel for two nights it cost Â£90 for two people. Not bad considering you really are only 2 stops from the O2 and only 20 mins to central london on the tube. Yes the carpet was a little bare in places. Yes the pillows were not the greatest but we had 3 in the room. Shower was OK. As for the noise i have to say i didn't notice it. Infact it was louder when i stayed on Oxford Street in a much more expensive hotel. In total i spent very little time in the hotel ( awake ) and i guess you will be doing the same. The breakfast was very good and at Â£7 not overpriced , the bar was OK for a quick drink after a long day in London. Reception was fine as were other members of staff. About as good as can be given the price. Overall i would go back to this hotel if i was going to an event in the O2 but i would make sure you got a good deal first. For what i paid i cannot complain if i had paid over Â£100 per night i would have been very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but would want something more central next time”
Reviews.Author: Warno
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights in may of 2011. It is close to Canary warf and very convenient for the elevated railway which runs in the east end. from there you can connect to several subway lines so the whole city is accessible. The journey from the airport to the hotel by subway was arduous but i made it okay. i felt sorry for the people on the subway who had to put up with my luggage as it was rushhour on a thursday night. the room was alright for the price, i realize london is expensive. i think i paid about $80 canadian a night which isn't bad. the room was small and the t.v. only seemed to have one channel but i wasn;t in the room much. there was no phone or radio/alarm clock in the room which i found unusual but no worries. there is a restaurant in the hotel but i didn;t eat there. if i was on a tight budget again and travelling on my own dime i wouldn't hesitate to stay here again but i wouldn;t mind something more central in the city even if i had to pay more which i know is the reality.

Reviews.Title: “Could Do Better”
Reviews.Author: chris_green100
Reviews.Content: Arrived to check in. Issues with a gentlemen two ahead of me due to a double booking for a specific room. Receptionist disappeared to try and sort out problem for an excessive length of time. Finally arrived back with duty manager who instructed her to get customer checked in into another room and that theyâ€™d deal with issue later. This had to be stated numerous times before she got the gist of what she was being told to do. Fifteen people waiting by this time. Finally got checked in. Got unpacked, found had when unpacking wash kit, hardly any toilet roll. Had to go down to ask for a fresh roll. Colleague staying at same hotel had same issue with toilet rolls on two separate occasions. Reception had them readily available which implied a known issue that housekeeping was not doing their expected duties. Corridors very tired, not the usual Travelodge pine veneered doors, the old Mahogany veneered which are usually dented and scratched. Extreme soft patch on floor by the sink. Concerned I could end up on the floor below. Road at back of hotel where my room was very noisy first thing in the morning. With dark mornings, the curtains didnâ€™t stop headlights coming into the room. Hotel needs a general tidy up with a good checklist for housekeeping to include such items as the toilet rolls and restocking of tea bags / milks etc. Close to DLR East India but due to security gates for Government buildings a person could easily get confused finding their way in the first instance. Breakfasts great, front area had always been cleaned up overnight of cig ends etc. Though there are a few issues Iâ€™ve specified, I did get an ok price through an internet booking website of only Â£47 per night B&B in a double room.

Reviews.Title: “My Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: StuttgartExpat
Reviews.Content: I've never been to a hotel where the carpet was so stained and the walls were dirty and stuff was caked onto the shower curtain. I also wasn't able to wash my hair as hairdryers are only available at the front desk for 2 hours and both times I tried, there were none available. I was also charged 10 pounds extra for an "early check-in" despite just checking in 50 minutes early. The only positive thing I could say about the hotel was the breakfast was decent. I wasn't expecting anything fancy but this hotel was downright grubby and definitely not worth the 120 pound/night price tag.

Reviews.Title: “wont be back”
Reviews.Author: Tammi A
Reviews.Content: Def a budget hotel. Wouldnt go back if you paid me. Hotel was grubby, bathroom foor was filthy. Room 3 was next to a corridor with a fire door and all it done all night was bang shut when other guests came through it. I know travel lodges are basic but i didnt expect to see rat/mouse catchers in the foyer. Couldnt even get a hairdryer as they didnt have any left? Staff werent exactly helpful. breakfask was ok but just ok. We left details how to get there on the tube and all we got was east india docks not how to get there when we got off!!!! So we ended up walking around the docklands at 12 oclock at night lucky a security guard helped us. And we need some pillows as one on a double bed isnt enough and they had ran out, one couple didnt even have any pillows or towels.

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: ajs_EP
Reviews.Content: Used to quite like Travelodges but they've gone downhill. The fittings in the rooms have been pared back to beyond the absolute minimum - no doors on cupboards, no pictures, no drawers. Very unwelcoming and shabby. The final straw was standing in the shower and finding there was absolutely nowhere to put the soap, shampoo etc. Not even a wire soap dish. Specifically at the Docklands Travelodge the traffic was extremely noisy and there are no restaurants or pubs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Overall you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Tigrlili
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for its location and easy access to central London. The hotel was much as we expected, staff seemed friendly enough and the room was very clean. However, on our first night, we found it very difficult to sleep due to the horrendous traffic noise from the busy road almost outside our window. The following morning, I went down to reception and asked if it would be possible to be moved to a room on the other side of the hotel and was very pleasantly surprised by the helpfulness of the friendly receptionist who asked us to leave our cases ready to be moved and told us they would be waiting in our new room when we returned from our day out, which they were. The restaraunt was fine and the food enjoyable and reasonably priced ~ all in all a fairly pleasant stay if all youre after is somewhere to lay your head after a day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: mrsmin_10
Reviews.Content: The room was Â£66 for the night, standard budget hotel room, must be one of the cheapest rooms in London. It was acceptably clean, a bit worn in places. Yes, the dual carriageway immediately beside it is noisy, but unless you have to open the window its not too bad. It didn't keep me awake. There is literally nowhere to eat near this hotel but the Bar Cafe at the hotel offered a reasonable menu. It's a very short walk from the East India DLR station, take the footbridge towards the lake, just walk straight on and you'll find it. It's very close to the O2 and Canary Wharf. Pack a hair dryer, don't expect frills and you'll find this a cheap night's stay. Some of the reports about this hotel had me worried, but my own experience was that it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap? .... but why so nasty?”
Reviews.Author: Havago
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay overnight in London and booked at short notice. If I had paid Â£15 as offered in the Travelodge sale I would have thought it good value. However at Â£139.95, I felt badly cheated. For that money, I was initially given a basic room - no sheets, covers or pillows. I was then moved to a "newer" room along a corridor with dirty carpets. This room featured sheets and pillows, a single plastic chair and a very dusty curtain with was partly hanging down. The standard "work top" was of such cheap material that it had patches of chipboard showing through where the kettle or mugs had been resting. There were additional holes drilled where the television had been anchored. The panel radiator has attached to the wall at an odd angle giving a very sad appearance to the room. The bathroom was no better: the washbasin was blocked and the water splash had caused the joins to lift. Of course there was only a very small tablet of soap - no shampoo, showergel or shower cap. The shower worked well and fortunately I had my own shampoo as my hair would have been soaked under the spray. No hair dryer of course and the short shower curtain meant the bathroom was flooded. Obviously a common occurrence as the corners of the floor covering were showing water damage. I did not try the food. The good points about the hotel were the hot water and the cheerful reception staff. I was just sorry their equipment was equally unreliable and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “good base and value for money”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolThejones
Reviews.Content: hi, just returned from 3 night stay, checked in very fast at the automated machine given room on 3rd floor at front of hotel! the previus comments about traffic noise is not to be taken lightly, it is really noisy day and night! and the rooms are really warm so you need the window open from time to time. rooms are basic but have everything you need for a base when you are going to be in the room only to sleep. the kids pull out bed was tad uncomfortable and small. the double bed was the noisest bed i have ever slept on, it wasnt very comfortable and couldnt wait to come home to my comfy memory foam. we added the breakfasts onto our stay as we were staying with 2 under 5's, it was really good value for money and a good start to your day. the east india dlr station was about 2 minute walk and took about 10 mins to centre london, really handy. there isnt much in the area, that is bit downside, there is small shop the otherside of station.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your flippers!”
Reviews.Author: Dan P
Reviews.Content: Although travelodge is a budget hotel, this wasnt up to scratch. The room i had was on the main road which was really noisy from about 5am - not a problem at night!. The fire door outside my room hadnt seen WD40 in a few years and kept waking me up (im normally a heavy sleeper). When having a shower, the shower curtain was ineffective, although i didnt realise till i got out and half of the shower water was over the bathroom floor. Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “appalling bench mark for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ggeorgeous
Reviews.Content: -appalling condition for even a budget hotel if you call 260 pounds for 2 nights budget? -no airconditioning, -room so stuffy and hot. -the only circulating air being the window opening onto the London motorway, therefore NIL sleep! -the childrens beds [family room] were covered in cotton only..completely unhygenic.. no mattress protector at all. -beds so uncomfortable. -no washing service. hotel guest service very poor, no linen on the childrens beds even though the room was booked for 2 adults and 2 children only 1 towel in the room when the room was booked for 2 adults and 2 children therefore having to ask for and wait for linen and towels

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Ryan N
Reviews.Content: Jst to let people know I was booked in on the 5th October for the Rihanna Concert at the O2. I thought the room was fine but the first thing that went wrong was the bathrrom door handle fell off and my boyfriend had to let me out of the bathroom. I wasn't too fussed about this as it was fixed straight away. We got back from the concert wanted a bath and had no bath plug. Then we got into bed to see bed bugs. Need I say more. I have attached the phots of them. We were moved to Kings Cross Travelodge due to this and that place was just as bed. Please do not use this Travelodge. I cant honestly bare the thought of anyone else in that bed with them disgusting things on them. The place was also a wreck. Vomit on third floor and reception was just dirty.

Reviews.Title: “4TH TIME HERE BUT NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Claud1
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have stayed at this hotel 4 times in total now when visiting the O2 ARENA. It is very close to the O2 by tube/DLR however if your not seeing an event at the O2 arena then DONT stay here as its far to out the way from all the good things in London. Its in quite a rough surrounding area and no shops resturants or anything, just simply office blocks. When i stayed here years ago when it had near to first opened i was really impressed for the price. I paid Â£50 for the room this time which i feel is a rip off baring in mind how rubbish location it is etc, before i had previously only paid Â£29. The staff are so rude here now, they didnt ask me how my stay was when i checked out just merely took the key card off me! The bar staff are rude and cant crack a smile as are all the staff at this hotel. I am fully aware this is a travel lodge and not to expect too much but i really feel the Travel Lodge management should read these reviews and so something about this hotel because its apalling! Although i was staying in a DOUBLE room with my husband (meaning 2 people) we were only allowed 1 towel to share! Seriously!!! We were also only allowed 1 thin pillow each??!!! The bed was sooooo uncomfortable its unreal. No air con or fan in the room which meant we had to keep the window open with all the traffic noise of the road. Terrible! No batteries in the remote control. We literally slept for about 3 hours the whole night and that was on and off. I recomend anyone going to the O2 to see an event to pay a little extra and go somewhere else, there are other hotels near the O2 ARENA. I wont ever be staying here again. Had a very bad experience at the Travel Lodge Covent Garden (old building) previously aswell, it was just unbearable. Save your money, pay a little extra and be happy this place is a shambles!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable budget choicce for London”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshireman43
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel before and considered it OK. The room this time was basically clean and functional, apart from the lack of a plug in the bathroom washbasin, eventually replaced with one the wrong size after two requests. As commented in other reviews, my room overlooked the main road and was a bit noisy if the window was left open. My biggest beef was a repeat of the comment I made to the management at a previous visit in March 2011. The tables in the restaurant were permanently sticky. After each customer they were only given a cursory wipe with a damp cloth. There was no evidence of any cleaner being used making them generally rather unpleasant. There seemed to be a significant difference in the attitudes of various members of staff. At the first visit the recepionist immediately responded to any request and was generally very helpful, whereas the staff during the visit described here needed to be asked several times before a request was carried out. Overall this was a reasonable budget hotel, typical of the chain and generally acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on the hard shoulder of the M25!!!”
Reviews.Author: imogensdad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times before and thought it was just OK. This time, I couldnt find anywhere else. I checked in late and was given a room on the back of the hotel. I was told I was lucky and they only had 2 rooms left and 4 people still to check in!!! This is their policy apparently. They have to find you somewhere else if its overbooked????? The room was standard travelodge but was about 10 metres from the A13! The soundproofing was non existant. The room was very hotel even though no heating was on but there was no way you could open the window!!!! Checked out very tired and disatisfied. I wouldnt mind but its not even cheap!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but restless”
Reviews.Author: lamblamlamb
Reviews.Content: Stay on the August Bank Holiday Monday, getting to the hotel was easy untill I got off at the station near it as I was using google maps on my smart phone and it was giving me the wrong location. It is actually close to the station just a few minutes walk. I got to the hotel and check in. The rooms are pretty much up to travelodge standard so if you been in them you know what to except. It would normaly be ok except the location of the hotel. It is right next to a busy main road and my room was facing it. Even closing the window will not stop all the sound. Getting to sleep was a problem and I woke up a 5 in the morning due to the sound of the traffic so really didn't get a good sleep. The main road is mention on their website so you are giving warning. In all the hotel is ok but let down by that main road. Should I come again I will ask to be put on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HARDLY SLEPT AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: Tillyfloss_9
Reviews.Content: Having had a surprising good night's stay at Travelodge Waterloo earlier in the year, we decided to book this one at Docklands for an overnight stay whilst taking our daughter up to University. The room was basic but clean, but we did not expect it to be so noisy. We had to shut the window so boiled all night and we still could not escape from the incessant traffic noise that permeated the room all night. Would never stay here again. We were very disappointed also with immediate area. We had hoped to go out for dinner but after driving past the hotel several times (sat nav postcode given by Travelodge is incorrect!) we soon realised that there appeared to be no bars or restaurants in immediate walking distance (unless we missed them). We had to eat in and the food was not good. Didn't stay for breakfast - just wanted to get out of the place as quickly as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: phillip1907
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times as it is reasonably priced with the added convenience of a car park (reasonable charges) and close to the DLR for getting into Docklands, the City and the West End but thereâ€™s nothing much in the locality. Managed to get a "quiet room" as staying on the road side or close to the service area can get noisy, but then you are in a busy area. There were a couple of minor niggles upon arrival, such as not enough towels in the room, but these were dealt with quickly and politely by the staff. The room itself was â€œcompactâ€� and showing its age a little but it is just a place to sleep, not a place to hang-out, but why would you.

Reviews.Title: “Well... it's cheap”
Reviews.Author: MsMoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, well, because we had to kill 8 hours overnight in London and this was the cheapest way of doing it. It's a Travelodge - you know you're not getting anything fancy. Benefits were a flatscreen TV and.... a bed. The downsides? The curtains in our room were different lengths (a good 15cm different!) and the shower curtain in the shower seemed to operate as a form of transportation system to get water out of the shower and onto the floor (resulting in the bathroom looking like a pond and me having soaking wet clothes to drag in a suitcase through Europe until I could find somewhere to dry them), but it was about Â£39 for the night, so I can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but avoid the cooked breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sea_urchin19
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 30 mins DLR in a less inhabited part of town. Low price for a London hotel, so I can accept the less than pristine condition of the room, the fairly hard and unforgiving mattress, and the noise from the nearby A road and City airport (though in fairness, I found the window open in the morning so perhaps the double glazing would have minimised the noise enough). The room was worn but clean & there was an extra towel already there. remember - Travelodge don't supply toiletries so bring your own! The cooked breakfast was lousy quality, no mush/hash browns, and no veggie meat alternatives. There was toast/croissants/mini muffins and fruit/cereal as well, but for Â£7 I want a cooked breakfast or I cd have gone to a supermarket(that was the point of adding it on). Also I was fortunate enough to get up earlier than planned (before 8). But around 8.30 the queue was out the door (about 30 people waiting); if they are going to cater to that many they should get more staff to help. Would stay again - without the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: budgiegirl40
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Travelodge for two nights with my three children, in a family room. We faced the car park, so the noise was not too bad, which was good as it was very hot and we had the window open all night. The room was clean, but a bit shabby, torn carpet, bath panel badly fitted etc, could do with an update. But it was perfectly funtional, and suited us just fine. The staff were friendly and helpful. For the money, (Â£80 for two nights including breakfast for all 4 of us) I thought it was excellent value, and I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: claireuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and two children. We got a good deal, just under Â£100 for the two nights inc breakfast for us all. I found the room clean , yes its fairly basic but I thought great value. I was not expecting much from the breakfast which we booked online at the time of the booking room but it was great , lots to choose from inc hot cooked breakfast. I would point out that we got there just after 8 am , after 8.30 there was a big queue. Just a few mins walk to the DLR so was great location. We drove to the hotel and was only Â£5 to park for 24 hrs. Only negatives were the room was very hot and was there alot of noise from traffic and planes - take some ear plugs and you will be fine. I am sure there isnt a quiet hotel in London ! I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for!!”
Reviews.Author: oldbird71
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our late 50's. Needed 2 nights near Docklands at a reasonable price. We paid Â£116 for 2 nights bed and breakfast for the 2 of us. Parking was Â£5-00 per day in a safe carpark. Reception staff pleasant and we were able to change our room on request from rear (noisy) to one overlooking the carpark. OK, it was a basic room but it was clean and comfortable with a TV and tea and coffee facities. Hot water and powerful shower. No air con and it hit high temperatures but we coped. Our price included breakfast and the staff were working hard as the place was VERY busy. Good choice of food and drinks. We slept fine but we did take our own pillows! Building bit scruffy inside but it does cater for many people. All in all we would stay again as great value for money.The bar prices were ok too!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Ive had to threaten court action!”
Reviews.Author: Garryjb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family and friends as we were running the London Marathon. The initial reception staff were very helpful..however from there it went down hill! The room was OK..however the cleaners dont seem to clean..we had no toilet paper and had to take it from the bar toilets,! Traveleodge management your paying for staff who arent doing their job properly. The pillows are just pillow cases with a bit of fluff in them..they are flat as pancakes. All of our party and most of the guests we spoke to wanted extra pillows, but when i asked they were all out! After completing the marathon we decided to have a meal in the restaurant. We were all wearing our finishers T shirts (bear in mind you only get these if you complete the marathon..so they are special). The bar man was a miserable guy, and tried to give out lipstick stained glasses. The incompetent waiter decided to spill curry over my T shirt and jeans..permanently staining them. I reported it all, and when i got home emailed and wrote numerous letters seeking compensation. I was initially fobbed off, however persisted and had to threaten court action to receive the compensation. They have finally apologised however the damage is done... I would sooner stay in my car

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you are desperate...”
Reviews.Author: dave_fo
Reviews.Content: Place is rammed (full booked because the London triathlon is on near by): one guy in the bar and one on reception. Rooms are a mess, staff are stroppy and place seems to be falling apart. Don't get cancellation insurance either, that's another saga that will not doubt run and run...

Reviews.Title: “Simple, functional, not the worst”
Reviews.Author: KennethTan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 3 -- 4 min walk from East India DLR station. There isn't much between the station and the hotel, except large buildings which are understood to be data centres. Location wise, this hotel is well located for the DLR. In terms of decor, the hotel could benefit from a renovation. It is looking aged. But aside from that, it is simple and functional. It has the standard basic Travelodge bathroom, bed and TV, and not much more. The carpets appear to have stains. The hallway could be better aired. I did not eat at the hotel, nor anywhere near the hotel, so I am not able to comment on food in that regard.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FingersBiggleswade
Reviews.Content: Above average to good value for money, particularly if in our case it is a short stop over. Clean, with minimum facilities but the basics needed for what these hotels are designed and catering for. Would have liked to see a smile on the barmans face, however was pleased with the prices at the bar not being far above that of my local. The downside, being that as there appeared to be no aircon. It was too warm not to have the window open resulting in a sleepless night due to being on the dual carriagway side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one word.....DUMP!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheIons
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, knackerd beds, and rude staff was just about enough to spoil a 40th birthday surprise for my best friend.....would never do it again in afraid......enough said!!! Though she said Barry Manilow was awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but excellent location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Emjoann
Reviews.Content: Very basic (but what you would expect from a Travelodge). Room was however very clean, as were the white bedding and towels. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room got very hot (would hate to stay here in high summer) and the noise from the road is horrific and relentless and kept me awake - although they do warn you about this on the website. We didn't have breakfast but did have an evening meal, the food was cheap and cheerful but perfectly adequate. The best thing about this hotel is its location, catch the DLR out from Central London. Its a scenic trip and only takes 10-15 mins. When you exit the DLR at East India (which falls just within Zone 2) make sure you exit over the bridge, Travelodge is then a 5 minute walk. Also this hotel is outside the congestion zone and parking is cheap. I would certainly recommend this hotel if you will using it just for a base and will be out most of the day. For the money paid, this hotel is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the O2 not much else”
Reviews.Author: Sage_21
Reviews.Content: Positives: Cheap. Very close to the O2. Good sized room. Breakfast was lovely with a great selection. Good check out time. Negatives: Airplanes go over head ALL times of day. Beds uncomfortable. Not enough pillows. Too far out for anything other than the O2. Meal selection was poor and overpriced as well as drinks. Far too hot in rooms - heating was on in July. Staff weren't very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad bad”
Reviews.Author: Glenvine32
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of travel lodges in the past and this was worst. It felt dirty and Grundy. The corridors need a lick of paint. There was stains on the carpet. The shower looked dirty with all grout and seal black. We know facilities were basic and that's fine but I have always said you except it to be clean. The room was dark and lighting very poor. What I seen the whole place needs to be decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish! Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Nonamepresent
Reviews.Content: We checked in for one night to see a show at the O2. Reception staff rude upon arrival. One hour after we checked in, without any knock or warning, a housekeeper walked straight into our room. When asked by my partner to leave, they seemed to not understand English and carried on checking the bathroom regardless. After that, I felt so unsafe there. We took all out valuables to the show with us and I barely slept a wink all night. No real explanation from the staff, although we got free breakfast, which was cold and rubbery. Only had one towl in the room, even though it was booked for two adults. Avoid this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “particularly poor for a travelodge”
Reviews.Author: AnneB32
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few Travelodge's around the UK, including others in London, and this one is particularly poor for a number of reasons. Yes Travelodge is a budget chain and I'm fine with cheap and cheerful as long as it's clean and tidy but this Travelodge has definitely seen better days. Particular down points for me: 1. The lack of cleanliness both in the rooms and communal areas. I'm talking about dusty surfaces, carpets that are ancient and need replacing, mould in the showers, cobwebs in the restaurant. 2. Pretty dire buffet breakfast - the sausages are awful and the egg is powdered and looks more like mashed potato. Never had a breakfast as bad in any budget chain hotel I've stayed at in the UK. 3. only giving you one bath towel for two people. What's that all about? Plus points: 1. really close to East India station on the DLR, which is the last station in zone 2. 2. I slept well on all 3 nights. Yes the rooms are hot, just open the window, yes it's noisy, it's London - buy some earplugs. I don't think I'd stay again, there are better places for the same amount of money. It didn't ruin my time in London because we were literally only using it as somewhere to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: mousepractice
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Travelodge to go to the O2. It's pretty close to the tube (DLR) so the journey is easy. Rooms were clean and quite large, and the bar was open late with outside seating. Very plesant stay and we would definitely return. Be aware though, that there are no bars, restaurants or shops near this Travelodge, it's in a large office area that is pretty much dead during the evenings and weekends, The nearest shop is a supermarket the other side of the tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the desperate”
Reviews.Author: Enoch_Sneed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Travelodge London Docklands because it was Wimbledon fortnight and accommodation in Central London was either non-existent or ruinously expensive. My room was overheated and airless, with no form of ventilation or air conditioning. It was so stuffy I barely slept. From the window I had a wonderful view of a brick wall and some pipework about two metres away. I ate at the hotel for the sake of convenience and waited 50 minutes for a baked potato and some salad. I had to give my order twice, and the first time the food arrived it was wrong. It was barely warm when it was served. At a nearby table some other guests waited an hour for their main course and when it arrived some of their food was still FROZEN! This hotel really needs to get its act together.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, will definitely use again”
Reviews.Author: GuernseyIslandgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two friends in a family room, we were going to concert at 02 and this hotel was really close. The DLR is only 5mins walk away. Our room was spotless, plenty of towels, tea and coffee. Staff really friendly and helpful, nice bar and breakfast buffet. I haven't stayed in this part of London before but will definitely use this hotel again, it was very quiet, didn't hear a single alarm or emergency vehicle, practically unheard of in London:o)

Reviews.Title: “Great base for the O2 and exploring London!”
Reviews.Author: Rick64
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Traveldoge London Dockland's for my second time and on both occasions have found it comfortable, friendly, and adequate for my needs.. I was slightly concerned reading some of the negative comments left on TA, and although I realise that everyone has different levels of expectation and quality, this hotel has served me well enough for me to book it again in the Autumn. As one review stated, the even number rooms face towards the A13 into London. The odd number rooms seem to face the quieter area behind the hotel. I was on the A13 side on the 3rd floor and had no trouble sleeping, especially after a long day sightseeing. I stayed 2 nights including breakfast buffet, which was very enjoyable. There was a fair variety, including cereals, hot food, toast, croissants, tea, coffee, juices etc, and more than adequate to set you up for the day. The staff were always friendly and welcoming, and the car parking was only Â£5 per day for hotel patrons. East India DLR station is only 5 minutes walk with links direct into the city. The O2 Arena is only 2 stops away. Travelodge's were never desinged to be a luxury hotel, but a basic reliable base for business and leisure breaks. Keep an open mind, stay here, and enjoy your visit to London !!

Reviews.Title: “Still very good.”
Reviews.Author: DevonRobbie
Reviews.Content: My wife & myself stayed at this hotel for one night last week (10/06/11.) I've stayed twice before so I can only repeat...good enough accommodation for the price,(Â£50) friendly, helpful staff, convenient & cheap car parking (Â£5 for 24 hours) good transport links to central London (DLR station 5 minute walk & 25 mins into London) Lots of shops, restaurants etc. at Canary Wharf (5mins by DLR or 277 bus, round the corner from the hotel) Here's a tip...forget the hotels Â£7.50 breakfast, take a 5 minute walk to the little Italian cafe next to the council offices. (its called The Sandwich Box, or something like that!) The all day breakfast is Â£4.20 & the coffee is great!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, some minor hassles, but be careful of valuables.”
Reviews.Author: thc8
Reviews.Content: Overheard another guest complaining to reception that she left her passport and money in the hotel room on the table or something, and it went missing, which means it was clearly stolen by staff. The receptionist denied the staff were behind the theft, but who else has access to a locked room other than staff?! Just be careful and lock your luggage, keep all valuables with you especially when you're out. Nothing happened to me, fortunately. Rooms are simple, and clean enough. Do note that some toiletries such as shampoo and soap are not provided, so come prepared. 3 of us were staying in the room, but only 2 sets of towels and extra blankets are provided. We didn't expect too much due to the price though. The wooden panel lining the outside of the bath tub seemed rather worn, but everything else was okay. Location wise it seems a little out of the way though, if you are seeing the main sights in London (the museums, Tower of London, Buckingham Palace). That it is near a DLR instead of a Tube station makes it a little more troublesome. The surroundings are very quiet at night, you probably won't be able to get much food within a 5-10 min walk. For some reason we had to get our cards swiped (to rest it, apparently) everyday either after breakfast, or when we returned in the evening. And as mentioned previously, the even numbered rooms facing the main road can be noisy. The odd numbered rooms facing the carpark might be better. But being a city person this was tolerable for me.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable budget stay in London”
Reviews.Author: tripaddvisor
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all with our overnight stay here. A very comfortable stay for the price. My hubbie and I were given a 'family room' - which was quite spacious. The beds in these budget hotels are always a bit of a weird trampoline experience, but shower was very good. There was a bit of early morning aircraft noise - presumably from City Airport? But we were up by then anyway, so wasn't a problem for us. The breakfast was pretty decent, set us up for the day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. In common with previous reviewers, the only thing I would say is that the hotel isn't well sign posted (if at all?) - particularly so for pedestrians. Not everyone travels by car. Only because I'd Googled it beforehand I had a rough idea of where I was headed after arriving off the DLR at East India Station. After deciding (rightly as it turned out) to exit the station via the footbridge over the dual carriageway, rather than continue down to street-level, and then after a while almost accidentally sighting the hotel, I ended up walking all the way around the block and a way down the main road, because I didn't spot where the hotel entrance was. Not a big deal on a light summer's evening, just took me longer than necessary to get there. But if I was travelling on my own on a dark winter's night, in an unfamiliar part of London and past big anonymous buildings - a few signs to point the way wouldn't go amiss. I noticed other hotels are signposted from East India station, but not this one. Thank you for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen186451
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here a few times now when visiting central london for a few days. usual travelodge standards, rooms have always been clean and had adequate bedding etc. initially almost impossible to find as carpark is accessed vis a gated drive. the travelodge sign is not on the presenting wall as you approach from the back of the travelodge so we missed it twice and tried to go to the blackwall tunnel! cafe bar can be a bit hit and miss, on busy dates you will wait a long time, and food has been questionable, but on other dates the evening food is good. Breakfast usual standard with plenty being brought out. always a busy service though, regardless of when we have stayed. close to dlr line and we usually travel out to woolwich arsenal and walk through the town to catch the clipper boats up the thames. not much nearby the hotel tho, so slightly restricted, but will happily rebook here especially when rooms are on offer.

Reviews.Title: “hard to find but perfectly ok”
Reviews.Author: happyholidayer8
Reviews.Content: once you find this place it's absolutely fine, easy to get into the city, fab for the O2, nice staff, good breakfast, yes a bit noisy next to the main road but for Â£65 inc. breakfast in london i certainly wouldn't moan......... sat nav postcode only gives you A13 Docklands so type in 'saffron way' then you will find it as it's tucked away in a small development off the A13.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: thomascedar
Reviews.Content: I guess Travelodge are not interested in quality only quanity judging by the very poor standards they now have. The walls in the rooms were dirty, the sheets barely fitted the beds. The beds themselves are marginally more comfortable than the floor, the pillows were hard. Then there the breakfast, don't bother go anywhere else! If you want a good nights sleep you won't get it here unless you take your own earplugs because the noise from the main road and airplanes is a 24hr drone, with windows closed!! I wouldn't recommend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly decent. Perfect for O2 concert.”
Reviews.Author: Wiltshirerambler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights for a concert at the O2. Iâ€™ve very mixed experiences of Travelodge around the country but this one was surprisingly decent for once. Had a large family room on first floor immediately above the bar/cafe. Clean and basic (and all the lights worked in this one!). Powerful hot shower. Bed a little bit lumpy. Had a good meal in their cafe before going to the O2 concert (queues for food at the O2 are crazy and expensive too). Breakfast was the usual buffet. Don't bother trying for a late morning lay-in as the aircraft from London City Airport will wake you up if you leave the window open (from about 7:45am). Price for a stay here was by far better than the extortionate prices being asked for by other places in this area. And if you don't mind putting up with a basic room for a couple of nights then itâ€™s the perfect solution. Car park ok and more secure than most with an attendant in a hut. Make sure you get a parking voucher from reception so that you qualify for the cheaper parking rate at the machine. Travel to the O2 from here is easy by DLR from East India station (3 min walk from hotel) to Canning Town (one stop) and then the Jubilee Line (one stop) to North Greenwich (takes about 15 mins in all). Also a good connection by DLR into London for the tourist bits. Get yourself a TFL visitor Oyster smart card (online) to pay for bus and train travel (itâ€™s cheaper and easy to use).

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but nice”
Reviews.Author: Sandow_11
Reviews.Content: We had no major complaints. Staff were helpful and service quick and friendly. The room was clean but worn. Pretty noisy with a busy street outside, earplugs is a good advice. Communications to/from the city quick and easy with the DLR. Overall a good choise if youÂ´re not too picky about standards. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “great location for the O2. Decent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: val1969
Reviews.Content: |We stayed overnight for a concert at the O2. Brilliant location. Very basic room - but good enough for what we wanted. Got back from the O2 about 11.30pm - bar was open. Reasonable prices for beer but really crap guy behind the bar (won't name him). All other staff were really great. Had the breakfast - very good. Something for everyone. Great location for the O2.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: king32
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel and then read the reviews, i honestly don't know what people want for their money. We had a very friendly welcome, the reception were very helpful when we asked the easiest and cheapest way to get to the O2 and the room was clean. We had a room facing the road and could hardly hear the traffic at all. The breakfast was very well laid out and the staff were friendly and helpful. We would stay here again and even though everyone is entitled to their opinion, i feel some of these bad reviews are very harsh. If they want luxury, like they so obviously do, then they should go and pay The Ritz or The Savoy prices.

Reviews.Title: “24/7 traffic noise went i couldnt sleep”
Reviews.Author: evelyninhouston
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value, but shabby room (torn settee, worn out bed) and i had a low floor room facing the main road outside - poor soundproofing mean 24/7 traffic roar outside - not a good night sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value,comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: churchmouse33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Travel Lodge for the Royal Wedding weekend, it cost just Â£45 a night which was an amazing price given the busy weekend in London. reception staff helpful and friendly, room was what we expected for a Trave Lodge. Bedding and towels clean and adequate,flat screen TV and tea making facilities. We pre booked the buffet breakfast which was very enjoyable. There is a bar, dinner service and plenty of vending machines for snacks. Just a couple minutes walk to the DLR which connects to the London Tube System - cost Â£4 for a 3 zone ticket into centre of London. 24 hour parking Â£5 a night!!! Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round Value for London”
Reviews.Author: lee0n
Reviews.Content: Found the location a bit odd but very handy for Both the O2 and getting in and out of central London via the DLR network. Not to good if you get back late and want food as the only thing on offer is a Pizza but the bar is open until approx. 1.00a.am. We found the rooms very warm. The bed was very noisy and creaked and groaned when you moved or turned. It was very busy when we were there and it meant queueing for breakfast which did not seem to take to long. Overall not bad value for money

Reviews.Title: “good one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieinUKEngland Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were friendly. Rooms were clean. Stayed for London City Airport. Got taxi and was charged Â£18. Food was great and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs if you want any sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Colin52_11
Reviews.Content: From the outside it looks good, we thought! That is until you get inside your room. We booked a family room to share with our 13 and 14 year old kids. The main bed was terrible and "sank" in the middle. Myself and my husband spent the entire night clinging onto the end of the bed so we did not roll into the middle - no sleep at all. The kidâ€™s beds were absolutely disgusting. One bed was a sofa (not even a sofa bed!) the other was a "box" which had a mattress stuffed inside it. The mattresses on the sofa and in the box were so disgusting we contacted staff and insisted on a change - to be honest the replacements weren't much better but it was gone midnight by this time and we just wanted to try and sleep. The bathroom was filthy and there were large chunks of enamel missing from the bath and mould was growing up the wall and the panel on the bath. We had ONE bath towel for room occupancy of FOUR! We had 3 pillows between 4 of us and the kids had no duvets for their beds!! On checkout we complained to the receptionist who told us it was a "budget hotel". We are aware that Travelodge is not a star rated hotel and our Â£62 room price clearly reflected this however even a budget hotel should have basic hygiene standards surely? I have emailed customer services several times but they don't seem capable of responding. Like I said at the beginning - AVOID AT ALL COSTS if you want any sleep and if you value even the most basic hygiene standards!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusted”
Reviews.Author: Tilds35
Reviews.Content: I booked and paid for a double room at this hotel 3 months prior to our stay. Upon arrival following an event at the O2, my partner and I were advised that there were no rooms available. We were further advised when complaining that usual practice would be for them to send us by taxi to another hotel but that there were no hotels in the whole of London with any rooms available. My partner paid to use the Internet at the hotel, London Docklands, and the Travelodge website clearly showed availability at Gants Hill. When we advised the receptionist and Duty Manager of this they went behind the back of the reception saying they had to make a call and did not comeback out the front for 30 mins by which time 3-4 more people had arrived in the same situation. Needless to say we ended-up sleeping in the car which we had parked on site following demanding a refund. Checks on the web the next day showed that Travelodge have been the subject of whistle blowing by former employees that the over-booking of their hotels is actually a marketing strategy and happens all the time. No one from Travelodge ever responded to our numerous complaints. Caveat emptor, buyer beware, you get what you pay for and in our case that was a night spent freezing in a car.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: littleridingstar
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel after a long journey from the midlands. Had booked a family room for my husband, myself and our teenage daughter. Person on reception was very efficient and polite, but unfortunately when we entered our room there was a double bed made up the sofa bed where our daughter was supposed to be sleeping was still as a sofa! She went to reception and was told that all the bed linen was in the cupboard behind the door and we was to make it up ourselves. the room was very noisy with traffic noise and as the window didnt close properly was also very draughty for our daughter who was sleeping directly underneath. The bath hadnt been cleaned very well and still had hair in from the previous occupant. On the plus side that breakfast was very good quality and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID AVOID !”
Reviews.Author: gregc007
Reviews.Content: After arriving at 6pm and being told that in spite of a confirmed booking we could check in later, we arrived back a midnight after a concert to be told that there were no rooms available, either in this hotel or nearby elsewhere. At this stage there were at least 4 other guest in the same positon as us. The staffg did nothign to look for alternative accomodation, they instead, hid behind the wall and didnt attempt to enagae with any of us. After demanding a refund, now 1230am, left us to it...where did they think we went when they were constantly telling us that there was no alternative accomodation. Aftrer having our booking, and money, for several months they broke our contract in supplying a room and just left us out in the cold high and dry. Seems to me that if you book here, or any other Travel lodge might be abit of a lottery and they will be more than happy to let you sleep rough ! As i said in the title avoid avoid avoid, and not just this Travel Lodge all of them unless you are happy to endorse cowboy business ethics and a general lack of customer empthey and customer care

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Barney2103
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel as staying in London for a Kylie minogue concert at the 02 . I can describe this hotel in one word yuk ,please if you like to sleep then this is the wrong hotel for you. Booked for two nights only stayed one after only getting an hours sleep. Staff unhelpful room and matress was disgusting ,window and bathroom lock broken no hot water breakfast I'm sure only Luke warm by the amount of bacteria causing friction within it .I would not stay at this hotel again even if they payed me

Reviews.Title: “perfect! ideal location for the o2, clean, and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: julezthebrit
Reviews.Content: we arrived on the 30th march at 11am after a 4 hour journey from wales, we were greated with a very bubbly happy receptionist who although we were very early to get into our room she sorted it out and we were in our room within 10 minutes, the room was spotless and the location was perfect, about 5 minutes walk from the tube and 5 minutes cab journey to the o2 which was ideal as my daughter and friend were going to a concert that night, The bar at this travelodge was great , clean,spacious and friendly bar staff , my friend and i could relax as the girls got ready upstairs. After the concert we returned and we all slept like logs, my friend and i slept on the pull-out beds and it was really comfortable didnt wake all night, there was no noise from outside at all, overall i would rate this travelodge as one of the best i,ve stayed in in london, some people might disagree but it ticked all the boxes for my friend and i and 2 teenage girls.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: PeterMB1959
Reviews.Content: Booked in spite of some poor reviews and i'm glad I did.2 minute walk from Docklands Light Railway so perfect for Excel Conference Centre.20 mins from central London.Clean,reasonable room size,restaurant very good value for money.Ask for room overlooking carpark as other side faces busy road.Staff helpful and changed my booking to quiter room with no fuss

Reviews.Title: “Don,t stay there!!”
Reviews.Author: CupcakeCaz
Reviews.Content: Recently attended a conference at excel and stayed here. The first night the window didn't close properly. The constant drone from the traffic (room near traffic lights) meant I couldn't sleep. Room was disgusting, filthy net curtains, curtains didn't fit window,dirty shower curtains,lipstick and grime on Walls. In the bathroom the wash unit had a panel loose and marked. Overall very tatty,tired and not recommended. Breakfast very basic although main hotel areas better than the rooms....looks very deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Flightman82
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for two, myself and my sister for 2 nights. I requested no smoking and quiet room. Room 111 however, was extremely noisy and we got it changed to 112. This room actually stank of smoke ( No smoking ? ) and had a smell of what can only be described as cat urine.The flooring was sticky underfoot. The overall standard was of a run down 60's motel and quite unacceptable.It was extremely distressing to find ourselves in such a position. We subsequently managed to book a hotel in the city and departed without using the room. This was a special celebratory weekend, potentially ruined by a totally unacceptable standard of accommodation, in fact, the worst we have ever experienced. Thank goodness we were able to find alternative accommodation closer to the city, as otherwise, we would have returned home. Yes, that is how bad it was. I might add that I spent most of the previous day trying to telephone this Travelodge and the phone, although always ringing, was never answered. What a sad reflection on Travelodge standards. I subsequently sent a complaint in to Travelodge asking for their comments and like a previous reviewer, never received a reply; yet another bad reflection on this group and how it is run. I don't know if these standards are down to the local management, but rest assured, we won't be using this group again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: devers43
Reviews.Content: Arrived to be told that there wasn't a room available, I had booked and paid for this room a week a week prior to arrival.Needless to say i refused to leave,and insisted on my room, however they told me that all they had was a room that smelt heavily of smoke from the prior guests, and that another guest had just refused, was desperate so told them i would take it, i opened a window basically. room basic, although i didn't expect 5 star decor. didn't stay that nite as i had to queue all nite at the 02 arena with my daughter (x factor auditions). stayed the following day, was wrecked tired from no sleep, but managed to get to the bar for food, bar man was miserable, never smiled and very unprofessional, food wasn't great . Went up to room to sleep as we had not slept for 48hrs, woke up at 4am to shower as we had an early flight at stanstead, only to discover the part for turning the shower on at the taps was broken off, no shower! too late to run baths for all of us. Complained at reception, but the guy wasn't in the least bit interested, non professional all the way! all i can say is they were the worst staff ever. Advise people not to stay at this particular Travelodge, really bad experience, would have been better off staying in a tube station. Staff at the local McDonalds were more courteous and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience.”
Reviews.Author: abldabl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night. Everything was - OK, clean, quite, safe surroundings and nice location (about 250 meters to East India DLR Station, only 40 minutes away from city center. Paid 59 pounds for room, completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bikesbmr
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews of this hotel, I must say, what do people want. We found the hotel great value Â£119 for a family room for two nights, it was clean and tidy, with a nice bar and restaurant area. Great location for the docklands light railway (just approx. 500m away). One observation though it seems that the odd number rooms are on the quite side of the hotel away from the main road as stated in other reviews, so it might be worth bearing in mind when you book, but to be fair to Travelodge they do state that there might be some road noise.
