Now before anyone asks I am nothing to do with Travelodge just someone who has travelled extensively throughout the world and stayed in 5 star hotels down to shacks on the beach and in my experience you get what you pay for so if you are looking for 5 star don't book a Travelodge, but if you want good value for money then give them a try

Reviews.Title: “If planning to stay here for the 02 check theirs no disruptions before you travel”
Reviews.Author: nynewie
Reviews.Content: Basic, booked to stay for the 02. Unfortunately the day of our stay the dockland railway was mostly not available so we had to get a bus to another station in an outer zone to come back in for the 02 (cost more). The reception wernt very helpful in where we catch the bus.The buses back were a bit hit & miss too. So really what should have been a 1 stop to the 02 was a pain in the backside. We got stuck in the lift too, reception didnt seem very bothered by it. The lift help button didnt know when an engineer would get to us & asked for our location!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Bigboy7Devon
Reviews.Content: I will start with the positives. Excellent location for O2 arena and travelling into central London via the nearby Docklands Light Railway (East India Station) 5 minutes walk. The surrounding area is a modern business area and the outside of the hotel even looks fairly good. We weren't allowed to check in a minute before 3 O'clock even on the self service machines. The stairways and corridors were dirty and needed a good hoover. The room was ok except for a stain on the sheets, grubby shower curtain, big crack in bathroom sink, broken shelf behind the toilet and lack of towels and toilet roll which we had to go and ask for on both the days we stayed. The room was not cleaned on the second day that we stayed. The cleaners knocked on our door at 9.00 to find out if we were still in the room. We did complain to the manager but overall the service was terrible. I expect basic with Travelodge but not grubby and tatty. I would seriously pay a little extra and stay at Holiday inn express and get breakfast included next time if this is the way they are going to treat their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Philby_UK
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs a complete refurb - very tatty. Room had no pictures was very dark and, whilst looked clean, felt dirty - strange. Very basic fittings, shower/bathroom small and shower temperature control didn't work well. We found staff OK but not enthusiastic, breakfast OK. Stopped serving food at 10:00. 500 metres from nearest Tube (East India) and not particularly nice neighbourhood. If you're going to the O2 arena it's a useful place to stay for one night but no more.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Travelodge Bargains Come .. !”
Reviews.Author: Loosecannon
Reviews.Content: Another promotional Â£9 overnight bargain at one of their largest hotels ! But first you have to get there. Handy to have GPS, I am sure, but we had none. Area is adjacent the A13 and very close to the Blackwall Tunnel on the northern side of the Thames. Travelodge sign is prominent facing the A13. Whole area including the hotel is officially private roads and controlled by 'security' and traffic barriers. Ignore; they will let you through unhindered after a pause. Travelodge car park is not particularly large considering the hotel size and the car park is open to the public also. But we got parked late afternoon OK, bearing in mind it was January. The car park is Pay-and-Display but first get a chit from Reception which authorises a reduced car park charge to Â£5 per day (multi-entry). The pay machines are just outside the main hotel entrance. You push the yellow button to get 'Residents' charges and enter the expected time of departure and then you can pay by coin or credit/debit card. Display both the machine ticket and your chit from Reception in your car to placate Car Park Security. Large Reception area with automat machines for drinks and crsips/sweets. Two internet terminals also. Lifts to all floors. Reception friendly and efficient. Room a bit smaller than expected but already heated up to decent warmth (near zero outside). Shower only; no bath. A novelty was the main bathroom mirror apparently had an area of heating (like a car windscreen) so that condensation never forms on the glass immediately behind the sink. Room very clean and looked recently decorated but not the bathroom, though this latter was clean enough. Small flat screen TV. Tea/coffee making available. Had evening meal in the Bar/Cafe. A good size for once. Order at bar, pay and wait for delivery at your table. Food good and not too long to wait. Room overlooked A13 main road just 20 metres away so there was traffic roar all night. Actually checked to see if window ajar but, no, that was the reduced traffic noise ! Slept well considering. Might be best to insist on a room away from that side but I could not be bothered. All in all a pleasant enough stay but if you factor in the derisory cost of Â£9 for the night it was an absolute bargain (again !). Stay tuned; more coming up in the next few weeks !

Reviews.Title: “Requires total refurbishment - Review overall Service”
Reviews.Author: karen_beresford
Reviews.Content: Location too isolated dark walk at night from train station. Lack of basic facilities, i.e. No iron/board except on 1 floor (not on each floor) this room was not clean, ironing board needed new cover and steam iron with no facility to fill up with water/needed cleaning. Nowhere to hang ironed clothes in ironing room if more than 1 item. Front lift out of action for full week on site (may have been longer), stained carpets throughout reception, bar, stairwell and bedrooms. Bathroom not clean, mouldy shower curtain, dirty bath and sinks. Very noisy as no air con and window opened onto dual carriageway. As expensive as Hilton Docklands with less amenities/service/cleanliness. Preferred to drive daily (200 miles each way) than stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Business travellers - find somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TellSyd
Reviews.Content: As a regular visitor to Canary Wharf for work, I have frequently stayed in this hotel. It has 2 really bad flaws that have stopped me staying there ever again. First, their admin of corporate bookings is HOPELESS - they never can find the booking/confirmations; and there is always a check-in delay. Secondly, the even-numbered rooms overlook a main road and can be very noisy (especially lower floors) - if you get an odd-numbered room, it's fine. The hotel itself is pretty tired and tatty, and it's in a grotty location - but I don't really mind that as it is cheap and it is convenient for Canary Wharf by DLR. It's the 2 show stoppers above that really make it a bit of a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via anpther company - arrived to be told they had not beed paid by this company -also told could not check in til 3pm. Problem with payment sorted out with an apology - their mistake. got keycard and directed to room - keycard did not work - traipsed back to reception for new card. (this happened 5 times in the 3 nights I was there.) Room was basic and not overly clean - there was a piece of guest soap on the shower taps - i chose to leave it there to see how ell the rooms were cleaned - it was still there the morning I left. Food - time your meal well. food was rarely warm let alone hot. my suggestion is to get yourself some cereals and a cup of tea (teaspoons had to be asked for each day) and wait for the food to be topped up then go for it. the toaster took 3 times round the grill to get bread that even looked like toast. The location of the hotel is fine and is very near to the DLR at west india docks - just a few stropos from canary wharf. final comment - good location - wrong hotel chain. 'nuff said'

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the O2!”
Reviews.Author: p00kie87
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here after seeing a concert at the O2 arena. It's obviously not a 5* hotel and they don't pretend to be either. My friend and I only paid Â£40 in total for the night there and it did it's job, the room was clean and not too cramped and I'd say the only downside is the late check in time and the traffic noise from the main road all through the night but they do warn you about that on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Chewing gum on Celling!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cloggy8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel earlier in the month, as we had a party to attend in Canary Wharf. The Location for this was pretty close, just a short cab ride which was ideal. We picked this hotel as it was a reasonable price. I know the Travelodge is a basic hotel, but does basic mean it can be filthy?? On arrival the reception looked ok, although no one was at the desk. Waited about 5 minutes before someone appeared. The staff were polite and helpful, offered to book us a taxi for a bit later. The Room - Well what can i say, other than Disgusting. There was several pieces chewing gum stuck on the celling. Who does that!!! The shower curtain was a nice shade of brown (think it was originally white). Stains on the duvet and sheets which was a delight i must say. Apparently there was nothing the staff could do, as no other rooms available!!! I would never stay here again, and definitely would not recommend this to anyone. Stay some where else unless you dont mind staying in filth.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Jonesey404
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivers exactly what you would expect. It's positioned at the bottom end of the market, and doesn't pretend otherwise. If you have realistic expectations, you shouldn't be in for any surprises. Rooms aren't the cleanest, but are by no means dirty. Service at the reception desk and bar is fairly mediocre, as is the food. As a last-minute booking in London 2 weeks before Christmas, I wasn't expecting to be dazzled by the quality for Â£70 per night, and could have paid double to stay in the new Tower Hill Travelodge down the road if I wanted a better standard, or double that again for a more mainstream chain. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Lodge Docklands, cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: niblets
Reviews.Content: Travelled to London for 2 day conference on limited accomodation budget from the NHS. Chose this hotel, as previously stopped in Travel Lodge and have been ok. Attraction to hotel was the price of below Â£60 for bed and breakfast in London. Good location in relation to DLR, about 5 minute walk, felt safe in area. Regular trains to and from East India (closest DLR station....over foot bridge, turn right at bottom of stairs and keep walking. Very welcoming reception staff, very quick check in, I had booked via the internet. Information given about breakfast times. Double room ok...warm, fairly basic, but very clean, shower only, no bath. Views over office blocks, but quite attractive really. was on side of hotel without main road, so very quiet. Evening meals available in bar, but bar very cold. Was during the snowy snap in early December. Food ok, typical bar food, once again friendly staff. Breakfast ok, but cheap and cheerful. Not huge selection, but adequate. Check out easy. All in all, for the price paid, good stay, would stay again if not staying more than 3 days. Probably wouldn't consider any longer, due to basic room.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for o2 !”
Reviews.Author: Horleyflyer
Reviews.Content: No problems finding hotel from DLR. Felt like a bit of a strange location, surrounded by glassy office blocks. Easy check in , basic room but had all we needed and exactly what we expected.Room and rest of hotel was clean and tidy. Enjoyed our meal from the bar though could have been a little more generous with portion sizes . Vending machine in reception and internet access at Â£1 for 20 mins. ( Very useful when looking for a left luggage facility in central London ) Staff we dealt with were all friendly and polite. Would stay again , no probs !

Reviews.Title: “docklands travelodge near but yet so far.......”
Reviews.Author: eizabell
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the docklands hotel as we were going to a concert at the o2 arena thinking this was a good choice as it was not too far from the o2 but we had to go on 3 different lines on the underground just to get there. we would have been better staying nearer london bridge. The hotel smelt and the rooms were below the usual travelodge standard.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: johntyb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this travelodge whilst visiting London to watch a show. The room could only be described as a matchbox at best.We asked for double room but there was only 1 chair and three pillows, although another one could be obtained from reception. I have stayed at travelodges throughout the uk and this is the worst i've stayed at. We had a meal at the bar cafe which was akin to cheap frozen food heated up in a microwave. The breakfast was poor and also cold. The hotel was noisy although it wasn't from exterior traffic it was from incosiderate guests coming in at all hours of the night. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deplorable”
Reviews.Author: Thepoetsyd
Reviews.Content: Hotel lost booking fax so check in took half an hour and a copy confirmation refaxed. Given a disabled room, large holes in walls & doors, blood on sheets,dirt in bed, tea coffee etc but no kettle, no tv, both lifts broken, given a change of room to 4th floor! Twice told by reception they would collect items from change of room as they kept the key they forgot. Finally got shower at 10.30pm 2hrs after arriving! Avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for 02 - typical travelodge!”
Reviews.Author: doristoptravelagent
Reviews.Content: Stayed last weekend for 2 nights.....A couple of minutes from East India station on the DLR, and great for North Greenwich for the 02. We went for Peter Kay! 1st night went to a local pub called the Steamship a few mins walk from hotel.....and came back and ate in hotel.....a round of drinks and main course for 4 only #38 .....went into central London the following day.......takes about 45mins on tube Bank was shut on w/end so we had to go round on the Jubilee so took a bit longer than normal. If was going just to central London there are hotels closer in. Room we had was 331 overllooking East India road which is very noisy, room was warm so had to open window, Room was typically Travelodge.....clean and basic we booked on a sale so was only #69 per room for 2 nights so had no cause to complain.....only provided 1 large and one small towel for a double room which was a bit strange and did have to ask for an extra pillow....but it wasnt a problem. Would recommend breakfast book in advance and save #1 a day....all you can eat buffet breakfast..bacon, sausage, scrambled egg, beans and tomatoe plus cereals and fruit, croissants, muffins and toast. Staff were very friendly although the girl on reception was a little abrupt on arrival but I think she was just a bit racked off with people trying to check in early when they hadnt paid for early check in. On Sunday we had booked later train so as Travelodge dont do luggage storage we got on tube to Euston left cases at Left luggage #8 per item then went up to Camden Market.....great time had by all!!

Reviews.Title: “Ticked the right boxes and more importantly was able to sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: Not a bad Travelodge to be honest, was allocated room 229 which was facing East India Dock Road which is chock a block full of traffic most of the time, yet from the room, all that could be heard was a faint humming of the traffic noise. Room is the standard Travelodge fare, this one did not have a bath, just a shower tray. Bed was comfortable, and very little noise from guests in the vicinity passing by, although being midweek and full of business guests who value their sleep and are generally quiet, this was no surprise. I suspect at weekends when you get noisy groups in, this may be slightly different. Hotel is located a 2 minute walk from East India DLR station so easy access to the City, Canary Wharf, Stratford, Canning Town and the City Airport. and Bus 277 which runs all night stops 50 metres from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MrHotelLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November 2009 to attend an event in London - the hotel is located across the road from Docklands Airport with excellent views of the River Thames and Canary Wharf. There is a little noise from the airport , but this is to be expected. My stay here was two nights, the staff were accommodating and helpful with my requirements and nothing was too much for them. The room was quite hot and didn't appear to have air conditioning. The beds were also quite low on the floor. I had slight problems with my television in the room not working but this was soon sorted out by the helpful staff Breakfast was nice and plenty of hot food was available. I will definately we staying here again. The only drawback was a fire evacuation drill at 12.30am in the morning on one of the coldest nights in November and we were left outside for 30 minutes!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clare4204
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£120 for 2 nights, my husband , myself and 6 year old twins, it was very basic, dirty, we were left 1 towel and 3 cups on our arrival! The food is awful, the breakfast was very poor, the sausages were the cheapest going and full of fat , the toast has to go around 3 times to get the hint of a colour and we had to wait for 20 minutes the first day to be seated and on the second day we were told it was another 20 minute wait which we didn't have time to wait as we had to set off for Devon and the breakfast was not worth the wait, however they wouldn't refund us as we'd pre-booked the breakfast!!!! We had one pillow each and asked for another one as it was so uncomfortable and wre told it's one each!! On the positive side, parking is cheap and the location is excellent for a short walk to a DLR station and then on to the city centre. I would never stay here again at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: phleebhut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight with my extended family for my cousin's wedding and have no complaints at all. The hotel is in quiet surroundings with easy access to East India DLR station. My grandmother uses a wheelchair and I found the staff to be most helpful and accommodating for her needs. The room was clean, warm, comfortable and generously sized. It had plenty of storage space for our wedding clothes and I slept surprisingly well on a fold out futon type bed. There was also a television and a Bible. I can't say what the food was like as I didn't eat there myself but my family enjoyed their breakfast. The hotel could do with a facelift, it's not going to win any beauty contests, but overall very good value for money and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and needs a facelift to make the customer have some value for money”
Reviews.Author: Scoltand
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at a cost of Â£130, having stayed at other Travelodges for half the cost, I expected a bit more. I called in advance to request a room that did not back onto a busy dual carriageway. Room was very basic and ideally could do with updating and a bit of money spent on freshening it up. Bathroom was probably biggest let down, shower curtain needs changed and was not able to lock door. A paint would not go amiss. Luckily my work paid for this night as overall I would have grudged paying the amount for what I got in return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: slimmct
Reviews.Content: If working at any of the surrounding datacentres this hotel is highly recommended, a two minute walk to the closest ones. The proximity to the DLR allows easy access to central London once you're finished. The rooms are always clean, parking isn't normally a problem, the food can be a bit hit and miss, but overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Still value for money.”
Reviews.Author: DevonRobbie
Reviews.Content: I really can't agree with the views expressed by my fellow Devonian "silvertonsiren" & others, who clearly have had a very different experience! I stayed at this hotel wth my daughters in February & again with my wife only two weeks ago & our experience was very much as before. I agree that the hotel food is pretty bland & unexciting, but Canary Wharf (a.k.a. Docklands!) is less than a 10 minute bus ride away (the bus stops in the next street to the hotel) & Canary Wharf has dozens of eating places, plus pubs, bars shops etc. Our room was also quieter than before as we were on the 4th floor at the side of the building. As someone else pointed out, all the staff could be assumed to be "foreign", but all spoke perfect English & were polite & helpul. As for having to pay Â£5 for parking;- I suggest staying in a London hotel with no car park at all! Again, as detailed in a previous review;- cheap, comfotable hotel, nice bar, friendly staff, 5 minutes walk to the DLR station & 25 minutes into central London...I'd certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel-couldn't want any better”
Reviews.Author: kir2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a very reasonable 22 a night. I was quite concerned after reading the reviews on trip advisor, but went any way. We arrived at 7pm, and booked in. The reception staff were very friendly and efficient. You pay 5 a night for the parking-which has a 24 hr security guard. As we were having trouble with the ticket machine the receptionist came out to help us. The room was spacious and clean-if I wanted to be picky, which I dont, there was a slight mark on the ceiling, and if you leave your windo open you can hear road noise, but all that goes with the windows shut!! Had food in cafe-reasonable and good service, you can also eat in your room and they do pizza's until 1am. We needed extra pillows and were given them straight away. In the morning we asked which zones we would need on the tube-again they were excellent, marking the info on a little map of the tube for us to take with us. I can honestly say it is a very good hotel in a very good location. The DLR railway is a 2 min walk from travelodge, and there is a little cafe that does a fab brekkie just around the corner. A full breakfast and coffee is 5.50. We will definatley go back and stay here. I know that people have had bad experiences of this travelodge, but we couldnt fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay only for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: ashish2010
Reviews.Content: We were staying here for one night, as we got a good deal (less than GBP 40) for three people (room with a sofa bed). Although the room size was quite decent, and the bed comfortable, the surrounding area was too drab for a hotel location. Also, the hotel appeared to be a popular place for nightbirds as seemed by the profile of most of the guests we got to see there. Its a shame that we spotted empty beer bottles in the lift. Although the room was clean & comfy, the general ambience of the hotel is not very confidence-inspiring. The location also is not near to any touristy point (We were staying here as our friends were staying in nearby Canary Wharf). Other than that, the check-in, check-out was smooth. But I wouldnt be picking this as a good choice for families. Only for a quick budget nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive for the price”
Reviews.Author: emily2709
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my mum. I booked it originally as I was due to watch a gig at the O2 that was cancelled and would never normally book a hotel in the Docklands if I was visiting Central London, but I was impressed with the ease of getting to and from the hotel on the DLR. The hotel is 2 minutes from the station. You simply head over the bridge and down the stairs from the station, head straight on take the second right and you are there. The station is within Zone 2. Our room was slightly better than the Travelodges I have stayed at previously although a little smaller. It had a comfortable bed, a nice strong shower and a flat screen TV. The room was also clean and in good condition. One of the lifts was broken during our stay, but there was another lift slightly further away from the reception. Overall for Â£32 I was very impressed and would definitely recommend if you are visiting London on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: WhiteVan
Reviews.Content: Where do we start??, the lift was out of action for the whole time we stayed in the hotel, the quality of the furnishings within the rooms could be best described as being purchased from a car boot sale for a sum of around Â£20, my sons duvet exhibited disgusting stains and had to be changed and the bathroom door had no handle as it had falled off. Had the misfortune to visit the Cafe Bar for an evening meal where the order subsequently went mising and we had to wait for 1hr 20mins for our starter to arrive, when it did turn up quite frankly it was not worth the wait. As the for the main course we had the pie which came with a gravy that was probably used as engine oil in a previous life

Reviews.Title: “Food in restaurant UGH had to get a full refund !!! Stayed on 4th floor & found BOTH lifts didn't work !!! JOKE HOTEL !!”
Reviews.Author: whisk4eva
Reviews.Content: Hi to all who read my review I hope you find it useful I will keep it brief. Room average if your not fussy YOU ABSOLUTELY GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR & I'm sorry that I paid anything ! Had evening meal in restaurant SAVE YOUR MONEY IT WAS DISGUSTING we got a FULL refund with no problem from the manager !! You have to pay Â£5 to park in this car park which I think should be scrapped as your paying to stay in the hotel anyway & parking should be free !! If your not at all bothered by bad food, rip off prices for parking, very average rooms, staff could do better. Personally I would NEVER visit this hotel EVER AGAIN. Hope you find my review helpful.

Reviews.Title: “YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR ... BUT SLIGHT IMPROVEMENTS COULD BE MADE!”
Reviews.Author: miss_bagpuss
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and paid Â£29, a bargain in my eyes and at a rate that cheap I didn't expect the Ritz! The hotel parking is very reasonable Â£5 for 24 hours and there was plenty of spaces available. The hotel staff were very friendly and answered various questions we had ... they consisted of where is the nearest tube - 5 min walk, nearest shop - 10 min walk etc The lifts were out of use when we visited and had been for some time apparently. The room was very basic but like i said you expect that for the price but they were clean. The shower didn't have a suitable curtain and this lead to the floor being flooded everytime we showered. To be honest the only major issue I had was the noise ... the room faced onto the busy dual carriage way behind the hotel and this distrupted my sleep. A tip from me would be to request a room facing the car park.

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvhols043
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews on here we were dreading going, but thought hey its only one night !!! as soon as we arrived we were greeted by the car park attendant who was bot helpful and friendly,the check in was both quick and also very friendly giving good advice on how to best visit London attractions. The room was both spacious and clean we were very pleasantly surprised. we had food both in the evening and buffet breakfast which was of decent quality. breakfast got busy at times so we did have to wait for food,but it was busy so acceptable,we should have got up earlier lol.the breakfast cost us Â£7.?? online but the kids ate free !!!!! so was worth the money. the only negative that i could say was that one of the lifts was not working but they did tell you about the other one(we 2nd floor so no worries). And the sofa bed was a bit saggy if I'm being picky lol would come back again and would recommend. HOPE THIS HELPS !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably awful ... avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: silvertonsiren
Reviews.Content: This is described as a cheap hotel in Docklands. Wrong on two counts: it's not cheap and it's not in Docklands! The hotel is located in East India Dock Road, a couple of miles- and about 25 minutes - from Docklands, which can be seen in the distance. One night's stay cost me Â£64 in return for which there is no tea/coffe making facility, (there was a Coke machine in reception but, of course, it was broken), no phone, and I had to pay extra for a bit of soap. There is not even a payphone in reception. When I asked for a phone, the response from the automoton at check-in was "It's a budget hotel". This same response was trotted out to all the other people lined up at reception to complain about various things. Why bother with staff at all? Why not just paint "It's a budget hotel" on the wall above reception as that is the standard response to all enquiries!! I should have guessed that standards would be poor at any hotel which listed " a sheet" on its website as one of the amenities my room had to offer. I was also kept awake most of the night by the building site a few feet from the window. A truly awful experience. This is rock bottom accommodation and not particularly cheap once you've added on all the things you have to pay extra for which come as standard at other hotels which charge much the same. Considering it takes fully 25 minutes to get to Canary Wharf from this crummy location, I would advise that you stay out in the suburbs and commute to Docklands. Unhelpful staff, poor accommodation, dreadful location. Avoid this hotel chain like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad . . .”
Reviews.Author: DavidandFionaC
Reviews.Content: Just stayed six nights and it's OK for the money. Convenient location for DLR. Friendly reception and bar staff. Room cleaning is inconsistent - room will be fine when you arrive but daily cleaning thereafter is a bit iffy, they may not vacuum and probably won't replenish tea and coffee but you can get this from reception. And OK, one lift was out of order, but hey - look at the price of the room! Buffet breakfast is steep at Â£7.50 though, and only average quality. BUT the good news is Porto Azzurro in Clove Place, just a few yards detour on your way to the DLR station. A smart and friendly cafe bar, all breakfast items freshly cooked and top quality and at a MUCH lower price than the Travelodge's very average offering. Recommended absolutely, but unfortunately not open Sat/Sun.

Reviews.Title: “Awful place. Dirty, far from city center, expensive for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: applecores
Reviews.Content: The place is just BAD. Far from the center, dirty, staff completely disorganized, didn't even know what room was free, a complete mess. Do NOT go to this hotel, especially if you are with children. We had reserved and it still took them 1 1/2 hours to get us a room , and another hour to find a baby cot for us. The cot was broken, so we just couldn't use it and baby had to sleep with us. Room was stifling hot and noisy. Run down and dirty elevator and hallways. No phones in the room, remote control for TV broken. For what it offers, this place is a complete RIP-OFF.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Awkward_Veggie
Reviews.Content: GOOD 5 mins walk from DLR and perfect for the 02. Buy one get one free on cider when I visited. Plenty of coffee & chocolate machines in reception, large car park. Shower only, no bath. BAD Hotel a bit tatty & rundown, a coat of paint is needed throughout. All staff non-English speakers but perfectly helpful. It was on a noisy road which might keep you awake (take earplugs). All in all, OK for one night. Â£55 a night was a bit steep for the standard, but OK for London prices.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant atmosphere and price”
Reviews.Author: Ali-CFH
Reviews.Content: Brilliant little hotel, staff were very friendly, would advise putting a do not disturb sign up though, cleaners knock and enter for housekeeping without consent! Prices are very reasonable at bar, normal priced drinks and very efficient food service. Bar serves until 1am which is good after getting back from a music festival late. Location is a bit out the way but once you get used to the tube system it is fine, tube station (East India DLR) is really close to hotel, would recommend getting an oyster card for the underground system. Nice outside seating area where drinks and food can be taken, and despite being near a busy road (at back of hotel) no noise can be heard. The area hotel is in is really peaceful and mainly made up of offices, no people or traffic. A great hotel, a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: MilliePlymouth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to see a concert at the 02. It was a short walk across the footbridge from East India Station. Staff were helpful. Room was great for what we needed 3 friends sharing. Felt secure at night. Could order pizza up to 1 am (I think). To get to the 02 from east India it is a couple of tube stops away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff, ideal for London”
Reviews.Author: louthy1234
Reviews.Content: cheap hotel for london, cheap parking, outside of congestion charge. Friendly staff, bar/cafe perfect for a quick meal, drink, pizza etc. Ideal for travelling into London for whatever you are staying for! clean rooms and cleaned everyday. all in all a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo66
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 29th May & went to a concert at the O2 arena that night. The hotel is conveniently located as it's only a short walk to the East India station on the Docklands Light Railway, from there it's only a couple of stops to the O2. The hotel itself appears fairly new, the staff are friendly & efficient and check in is quick & straightforward. We had a double room which had a small bathroom including a shower. Incidentally, if you want a bath then book a family room as apparantly only the family rooms have a bath in them. The room itself was adequate & you get what you pay for. Unfortunately Travelodge seem to be installing very low quality beds these days. The mattress was uncomfortable & the bed creaked every time either of us moved which doesn't tend to provide a good nights sleep. The buffet breakfast cost Â£7.50 each & offered a good selection of choices from fruit to the traditional cooked breakfast. All in all, the hotel is what you expect from Travelodge, it's cheap & cheerfull & the location is extremely convenient for the O2, London City airport and also links for the centre of London. It's just a shame that they don't provide better quality beds.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what you pay....”
Reviews.Author: BuchananPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed up Thursday 27th to visit the 02 for a concert. The location was fine with easy transport from East India DLR to O2. Room was large enough for the three of us and quiet. The following morning we had a good breakfast and transferrd to another Travelodge at Southwark. The reception arranged early check in for us at Southwark for Â£10 which meant we went straight to the hotel at 10am, got our room and out for the day. Bar is on ground floor with access to ouside tables if weather good enough. Good stay as far as we were concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Not so close to Excel”
Reviews.Author: Lay9
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a hop, skip and a jump to Excel but it was not. You have to take DLR and then get off after two stops, coz the service is interupted at the moment and for how long, they are not sure.. then get on a bus....much easier to take a black cab..now that you know! I arrived at the hotel on one of the excellent Travelodge deals and paid Â£10.00 for 24hr parking. You have to go to reception to get a special ticket to place inside car . For what I paid...I am happy. Extra pillows and quilts were not a problem. Toilets in lounge area were dirty...if they could do something about that and have one or two really good dishes going on..such as a noon curry or platter to share of a nightime on the menu then they are onto a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Very busy but good location”
Reviews.Author: chwb2003
Reviews.Content: Never really been impressed with this hotel, its cheap so expectations never high anyway. Cleanliness isnt brilliant and bathrooms are tiny but decent comfy beds and TVs. Staff not exactly enthusiastic but this place always seems busy and often receives coach loads of tourists. The restuarant though really isnt that good, its very basic, like a school canteen in some ways. They dont seem to be able to handle large numbers of customers and the food seems to be microwave meals from the local supermarket. Breakfast is the worst thing though, very very basic and always too many people trying to get to the toaster. its a decent cheap hotel maybe for 1 night but dont try to get too comfortable. Very close to the East India DLR Station one stop away from Canning Town station or Poplar and Canary Wharf are within 5 minutes the other way.

Reviews.Title: “A lot better then some people make it out to be”
Reviews.Author: Cozmic-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I was reading some of the reviews on here and I have to say, did they even stay in the same hotel as me? I really can't say one bad thing about this hotel other then the pillows where a bit uncomfortable (but I'll live). The Staff where friendly and helpful, the room and the hotel in general was clean, was easy to get to and from (Was going to a concert at the O2) and enjoyed my breakfast there. I would have liked to go back this Travelodge again this year, but I got a better rate at the London City Airport one instead.. If you're after a good budget hotel not too far out of central London, then this one is worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing price, nice staff, good times all round!”
Reviews.Author: Madddie
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand why it has bad reviews!!!! I was coming to London to meet some friends for the first time. There was 4 of us but thought we would really do it on the cheap and fit all of us in the 1 room, which the staff didn't seem to question. The room was really clean, spacious (plenty of room to sleep at least 4 people!), The shower was powerful, the water was hot and the staff gave us plenty of towels, duvets and a hairdryer on request. The staff were super friendly and helped us order takeaways to our room. The breakfast was also very good value for money for all the stuff they had to offer, it really set us up for the day. The location was also good, about 40 minutes to get to Camden and 30 to Oxford Street. We were so pleased with our Â£35pn find and will be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised.”
Reviews.Author: DevonRobbie
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Travelodge's before:- one good, one mediocre, so I was still uncertain about this one. I needn't have worried.Though room prices reflect its location, it was still quite "convenient". The hotel was an easy 5 minute walk to the nearest DLR station (East India) & then 20 minutes on the DLR to connect with the Tube at Tower Hill. Our room was standard Travelodge, though the bar/restaurant were very pleasant. Staff were friendly & helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, convenient for central London.”
Reviews.Author: Sadm705
Reviews.Content: Just come back from four days at Travelodge, Docklands. Needed somewhere easy to drive to, avoid Congestion Charge and easy to access central London. This is it. Shall definitely return. Walk to East India DLR a couple of hundred yards. Station in zone 2 so off-peak day passes are fine. Rooms typical Travelodge - clean, sufficient and friendly staff. The bar and cafe also typical Travelodge unfortunately, so save on money and time by walking towards the DLR then turning right by board advertising Cafe. There are three down here on the same private estate as the Travelodge and all good value. Breakfasts especially good at present. Car parking at Travelodge Â£5 a day through ticket machine - but also needs 'resident permit' from Travelodge reception. Arrive early though as park doubles as commuter park for london.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay”
Reviews.Author: tmlBucks
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was disgusting - dont pay extra for it , find any greasy spoon, or try the fat boys diner on Trinity Buoy Wharf who were great value The maid went into my sons room whilst we were waiting for breakfast (yes you have to wait and its disgusting..) When we got back she was there and his ipod touch wasnt it didnt turn up, the matter is with the police This has ruined his holiday, it took away from a great night out at the O2

Reviews.Title: “Great price so OK for a short stay but standards not as good as other Travelodges”
Reviews.Author: Traveller10045
Reviews.Content: Bed comfortable. No remote for TV, no plug for bath, bathroom door would not shut but would lock, sofa valance looked as though it had been chewed by a dog, curtains didn't close properly and minimal loo paper. I have stayed here before and quantity of loo paper was even worse then! Generally clean but shabby - chewing gum on corridor carpets, bathroom floor peeling. Nothing a handyman couldn't put right fairly quickly. Pile of vomit on outside area between reception and car park on Monday morning off putting - I would have thought a bucket of water could have been thrown over it. Great value as we had an extra cheap room but I would have been livid about the quality if I had paid full price. Perhaps shabby rooms are kept for overnighters on cheap deals. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “canceled with no refund”
Reviews.Author: NJPhil
Reviews.Content: I had to pay for entire stay at check-in, 7 nights. My business plan changed and I left early. Desk told me "no problem, office would refund me". After many emails and phone calls, they refuse to refund me for checking out early. They even refused after my credit card company contacted them. They said I paid for 7 nights and they are keeping my money.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here It's A Health Hazard !!”
Reviews.Author: OrnamentalBeauty
Reviews.Content: THE ROOMS ARE FILTHY, BLOOD STAINS ON SHEETS, SEMEN ON SOFA, MOULD ON WINDOW, DIRTY SHOWER CURTAINS, HAIRS IN BED, MUD ON HEADBOARD, CHEWING GUM ON BATHROOM FLOOR. Didn't even stay left early because it was that bad, missed out on sightseeing and was prepared to be really ill just to drive home. I planned to stay here on 23rd January 2010 for an event at the O2 It is disgusting. Staff are really unhelpful and give incorrect information. We arrived early and requested that we pay for the extra early check in to check in at 12 noon, and wew told that this has to be pre booked and there was no way we could do this, despite explaining to the receptionist that I have a disablilty and need to rest throughout the day. We were welcome to pay for the car parking and to leave our things in the car and to come back at 3pm (which was impossible as we had to be at o2 at 3pm) Left hotel and came back at 2pm after trying to waste time and aggravating my condition, we washed and chagnged in the toilets and enquired to see if we would be able to go into the room as soon as we returned from our event due to my condition. We were then told that they have early check in facility and we could go to the room immediatley for Â£10. We were basically told that we could have booked this earlier and that if I had gone onto my mobile and updated my booking online we also would have been able to check in at 12 noon (I was not a happy bunny) We advised that it was now a waste of money to pay for that at that time as we needed to leave to go to the O2. When we returned and finally returned to our room, the first thing we noticed was a huge semen stain on the sofa (not nice especially when there are children with you) We then noticed only drinks facilities for two (the room was booked for three) Had to go downstairs to get cups etc. Then we noticed that the whole room had been set for two, we had our own towels so had to go back for bedding. Bathroom was grubby Went to resturant it took 50mins for starter and main course to arrive together, customers who ordered after us had received their meal prior to us and had ordered the same. The meal came with chips when we opted for mash. When we advised we ordered mash, waitress said mash finished is that ok, I advised it would have to be as they did not let us know prior to this and give us the option to change our mind. At that the plate was taken away, the waitress returned and said we do mash now it will be 5 mins is this ok. We had waited 50 mins another 5 would make no difference. Anyway when food finally came I think the mash was leftovers off someone elses plate, mine had brown bits as though it had been placed next to some other food whilst my friends did not but had pepper on. All of the food was cold apart from the gravy. we did not eat the food. Returned to the room laid out the bedding we received earlier and there was blood stains on the duvet, this was supposed to have been taken out of the linen room. Closed the curtains there was mould on the window sill. Came out of bathroom, door handle came off in our hand (had to screw it back on) Pulled back the sheets and there were black hairs in the bed that could have been animal hairs. By this time it was passed midnight Decided there was no way we were staying and that we would travel for 4 hours to get home despite feeling extreme pain from my condition. Advised manager on reception that the room was disgusting and that it seemed like it had not been cleaned from the previous occupant told about blood, semen and mould and terrible actions by staff. She advised to complete form and someone would contact me the next day to arrange refund onto card. Guess what no phone call, I have written a six page complaint to head office with photo's

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, price and location”
Reviews.Author: Allie-Beth
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night stay through Travel Republic at a great price. This hotel would have cost more than double if I'd booked direct with Travelodge. We (my partner, daughter and myself) stayed on 29th Dec for the Miley Cyrus concert (which was fab). The price included a hot buffet breakfast which was really nice, plenty of choice and quite busy, but easy to get seated. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. We parked the car in the hotel carpark for a Â£5 charge for 24 hours which I thought was great value. The rooms are basic, everything you could need (except toiletries) and clean. The hotel felt really secure as there was a security guard patrolling the car park area. You also needed to use your room key to access the door to the hallway to the rooms after exiting the lift. The hotel was situated a few minute drive to the arena, so would recommend to anyone going to a conert at the o2. In all, I would definatley stay there again, and would recommend the hotel to anyone wishing to book a bargain break near the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for what you pay!! The bad reviews don't sound like the same hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: 5_star_princess86
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed review on this hotel, I was somewhat nervous about staying at the hotel. We were travelling from far and the last thing you want is to turn up and find a dirty hotel, the way some of the reviews had described..... After speaking to a family friend who used to live nearby the hotel and had stayed in it because of business a few times, we decided that we would trust their judgement. They said it was briliant for what you pay, and to sum it up, it really was. There was NO mould on the curtains, fingernails on the carpets, dirty sheets etc...... I have no idea where all of this is coming from, and to be honest, how close were these people inspecting the carpet to find a fingernail?!!!! Also, as with all carpets even in people's houses, people have worn shoes over them and so its obviously not going to be clean enough to eat off!!!! However, the carpet WAS hoovered and clean ( and we are neat freaks and clean freaks and I don't usually stay in a hotel below a 4 star, we always stay in 5 star hotels, so I am a bit of a snob - even at my university accomodation, i have a deluxe room as I am used to luxury!). The room, the bathroom, was all clean. The only thing about the room I would have improved is a more comfortable sofabed - or a double sofa bed would be better as the ones here are single mattresses 1 each for 2 people, and the room was also really cold as there was only one heater and it would not heat up very quickly. But these are all small things, considering the snob I am, I couldn't believe how comfortable I was in the room. We were walking without our shoes on. We kept our socks on because it was cold, but honestly, our room was clean. One more thing is the other travelodge I have stayed in, in Manchester, had a larger family room with a lounge area and a bed area round the corner, so it was huge. This room was smaller than that, but was still big enough for 4 of us! Obviously with hotels you can't assess all rooms to be the same. Maybe some people did stay in bad rooms, but I highly doubt they are as bad as what some reviews say, as there were a lot of families staying there with young children, and even we had a young child with us, and everything was fine. We didn't have breakfast because we don't usually eat breakfast, but the service of the receptionists and bar tender were really friendly and I have no complaints. It WAS worth the money and was much better than some 4 star hotels I have stayed in in London!! This is the second travelodge I have stayed in - and both were brilliant. If you do get a room you are not happy with, ask very politely downstairs and they will move you, but you can't be rude to the receptionists as its not their fault if its not cleaned properly! I am sure you will find this hotel acceptable!Give it a try!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the O2 Arena”
Reviews.Author: larrythelamb05
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about this place I was begining to regret booking. I had no need to though ! clean, tidy nice room close to train station for the O2 staff freindly and helpful. breakfast nice plenty of food & plenty of room. Depeche mode were great too !!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable friendly clean”
Reviews.Author: mm85609
Reviews.Content: read the reviews before booking booked here for easy access to 02 and dlr stayed on monday 14th december quick book in and friendly staff clean room with extra towels / duvets had a few drinks after coming back from 02 once again friendly staff and reasonably priced there was some traffic noise but we had a good sleep and didnt hear much although we were warned about possible noise in other reviews friendly staff on check out asking us if we had a good stay

Reviews.Title: “it is disgusting”
Reviews.Author: cocktailsandbeaches
Reviews.Content: this was the most filthiest hotel I have ever stayed in - and trust me, i've stayed in a few not nice places. the shower curtain had mould on the inside. the room smelt of damp. the sofabed mattress was brown and covered in stains. the bedside table had appeard to have been ripped out by a previous occupant. the strobe lighting in the bathroom (which is ALWAYS flattering - not) was flickering. and on our return from our night out the only lift in the building was covered in vomit. like i said. it was disgusting. I came home and jumped in the shower straight away. honestly, and please please take this on board - stay at another hotel. if you're after budget, go to the premier inn. I only stayed there for one night and I couldn't wait to get out of there. This was my first time staying at a Travelodge and I will never ever be staying there again. If I can't afford a 4* it will be premier inn all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised !”
Reviews.Author: BCP69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending the ATP Tennis Finals at the O2 Arena. I booked the hotel for economy and practical reasons to be near our digs when leaving the o2 late at night. After booking ......I then turned to Trip Advisor (!!! Not the way its supposed to work ...read reviews then book !!) Half the reviews hated the place the other half satisified . We where pleasantly suprised , expecting the worst the hotel was well located and safe , front staff polite and helpfull.Room basic but definately clean ...especially the bathroom. Will use again .

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: Bejo2009
Reviews.Content: Booked in here for 2 nights by the company we were doing some work for. Not our choice but we thought it would be okay. Until we arrived. The receptionist was rude and unhelpful, hotel dirty and smelly. Needs total refurbishment. Silly things like no TV remote were annoying. Bathroom grubby and shower curtain disgusting. Breakfast was a farce - so awful you had to laugh. They hand you a cold plate as you enter the restaurant so that you can plate up your own sawdust sausages, cold scrambed (we think) egg and goodness what else it was all supposed to be. The bread for your toast was still in its packet and had to be put through the toaster three times to get it a light toasting! Generally awful and we will definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, a London bargain.”
Reviews.Author: travelchinchilla
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to holidaymakers, but if you're on a short trip and need to visit the O2 or the Excel centre, it's perfect. Buy the breakfast online with a discount or get it as part of a deal with the room and it's a bargain. I would not pay for the breakfast at reception. There are facilities to make coffee in your room, which doesn't taste too bad. You can pick up breakfast snacks near the DLR or at the service station about a 5 minute walk away. If you do buy the breakfast, it's actually worth the money if you or your friends/partner like a cooked English breakfast. I just ate the croissants and muffins, but it was nice to have the choice, The trick to getting breakfast to yourself is to go relatively late in the morning, around 9:30 am (breakfast runs until 11!) That way you miss the morning rush on tube, anyway. There isn't really anywhere to eat around the hotel - but you are in London, so you could just get the tube and eat in some brilliant restaurants; we went to the Bento Cafe in Camden. The room is very basic and the fabric on our sofa was worn. There was limescale in the toilet bowl, but this is difficult to get rid of in London because Thames Valley Water is very hard. Otherwise, the room, towels and linen were all very clean. The rooms are also quite big for a budget European city hotel. The plumbing and shower strength are better than what I have at home. The staff are quite friendly, though we did get some funny looks when we left the room in fancy dress. The bar was open until late and was reasonably priced by London standards. The selection of drinks wasn't brilliant, but I've seen worse. Annoyingly, when there is a band playing at the O2, they will play music by that band in the bar all day. Green Day were playing when we stayed, and now I don't want to hear any Green Day again for a long time. I am someone who goes to London about 3 or 4 times a year on a tight budget. I have stayed in Association Youth Hostels before to cut costs. Although hostels are value for money, so is this place. If you book early enough in advance, this hotel costs only slightly more than some hostels and you get your own room and bathroom, instead of sharing with 5 strangers. I might not need that YHA card for a while!

Reviews.Title: “Not awful but by no means good!”
Reviews.Author: magicalfountain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as it was close to the o2. It was basic which is the norm with a travelodge but i found the sheets had not been cleaned properly and the carpet cant have been hoovered as there was a broken finger nail on the floor. Parking was paid per day at the reception. Staff were ok. Bar served drinks till late and there were a few vending machines for snacks. Reception very busy and took a while to get checked in even though it was 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: TheBrownsOnTour
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on here, but had a pleasant surprise. The room was adequately clean, the shower was hot and powerful enough and the bed was very comfortable but could have done with more/bigger pillows. It was very convenient for the DLR. Breakfast was busy but still very organised compared to other hotels we have stayed in. We also had an evening meal which was delicious and very reasonably priced. Would highly recommend as an affordable hotel for visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: WhiskeyonaSunday
Reviews.Content: This place had come in for some criticism from other reviewers so I was slightly apprehensive about staying there, but I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, it's basic and there are more comfortable places to stay in London, but I'd have to sell an internal organ or two in order to be able to afford such accomodation. It's a Travelodge: you have to expect it to be basic. As long as it's comfortable, clean and the staff are helpful - all such criteria were fulfilled - you can't go wrong. It's easy to find from the DLR station (East India). Just cross the footbridge signposted for the town hall and it's just behind the big office blocks. It's a 2-3 minute walk. On the other side of the station, you have a supermarket that's open til 10pm (8pm on Sundays) where you can pick up some basic provisions. It's only six stops on the DLR to get to central London and the O2 Arena is just across the river, where you can find a number of restaurants and entertainment venues. All very convenient! The hotel has a perfectly adequate restaurant if you don't want to travel any further to eat. Again, it's basic, but reasonably priced. The only criticism I have to make is concerning the toilets in the hotel's restaurant. The Gent's toilet was in a particularly unpleasant state - obviously, I can't comment on the Ladie's loos - and that could really put you off your food! Otherwise, I enjoyed my stay and I'll definitely stay there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PermanentMarker
Reviews.Content: Just a two minute walk from East India DLR station it's perfect for a short break in London. The food in the restaurant/cafe is average but it's handy if you arrive late and don't want to travel far for a meal, as there are no other places to eat in the immediate area. The O2 is a great place to go for something to eat if you want to avoid the busy city centre, with plenty of choice from Thai, Italian, Chinese, Pizza etc, and there's a Japanese sushi bar opening soon. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the lobby has vending machines with snacks and drinks if you've forgotten to get something at the shop, and also two computer terminals if you need to check anything online. There's an outside seating area for smokers and some shelter from the rain if the weather turns. The staff are pleasant, friendly and willing to help if you have any queries. When i'm planning my next trip to London this is the first place i'll be checking for availability.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Damn Good”
Reviews.Author: The_Bennett
Reviews.Content: Check in was very fast, Clean room ( Beds, Bathroom and Furniture ). Location ok, Shut the window and you can't hear any noice. Staff were good, Food was excellent ( Cheap & cheerfull!!!!!! ). All round good experience. Overall have no complaints. Peace.

Reviews.Title: “Passable, but only Just”
Reviews.Author: Raydijaberu
Reviews.Content: Came down for a 4 day trip at the Docklands Travelodge. The hotel is based on what is really a nice Industrial Estate, if driving you need to be let in, to parkers in the car park try to stay to the right hand side as most of the vandalism is caused to cars on the left hand side (just past the bar). Reception will try to sell you the breakfast for Â£7.50 per head, dont bother with this as if you walk out of the hotel and bear right , take a right at the first park bench on the right hand side (5 min walk) you will find an Italian restraunt (very average but only Â£5 a meal), a newsagents (great for cheaper drinks (open till 6pm) and best of all a sandwich shop / cafe (open until about 3pm) -its just past the newsagents that does a superb Bacon sandwich for Â£2.50 or a full english for Â£4. There is also a store that does alcohol over the DLR bridge on the other side which is well priced and open until at least 10pm. The Hotel itself is basic, typical Travelodge fair and could do with some TLC, the room (stayed on upper floors) was of adequate size, bed was clean, seat was bloody awful and uncomfortable while the bathroom had some mildew and grot around the toilet and curtain, but just about acceptable. One major issue I found with the staff was that it was nearly impossible to get a replacement loo roll, in the end I gave up and bought a pack from the store, another thing I never understand is why you always only get 3 pillows, credit to the reception I got another when I asked (Although the first offered was dirty) All said and done its a basic but acceptable hotel if all you want is a base, just dont expect any frills or extras, ok for 2-3 days but any longer than that is pushing it unless you are on a very tight budget. Transport links are reasonably good with Canary Wharf being 10 mins away on the DLR and central London being about 20-25 away. I would say eat or bring something back as the bar is reheated stuff and not worth the elevated prices but there is not anything close bar the DLR to Canary Wharf (Heron Quays for the excellent shopping centre which houses Nando's, Tiffinbites, Burgers and the all great Wagamama (ate there 3 times :))

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here With Children”
Reviews.Author: Wotnohair
Reviews.Content: With two children aged 3 and 6, a family room was booked.On arrival on Sunday 9th Aug 2009 we were told that everything was made up and ready. The family room allocated to us was facing the main A12, an incredibly busy, noisy main road which kept the children awake for both nights. The room could not be changed as it was 'made up' being the receptionist excuse. The excuse was made up more like! What twaddle - I had to pull out and make the two single beds myself. I had to walk back to reception to get the correct number of towels as they had put two out for the four of us. After a night of very little sleep came the battle of the plates. A massive queue to get in to the dining area, as the hotel did not have enough glasses, plates, cups or cutlery and kept you waiting outside. Guests were going into the kitchen and washing up the crockery themselves. On the second day we waited so long that we gave up and went elsewhere for food. The hotel is a joke - avoid like the plague if you want to sleep and have breakfast when you wake up - funnily enough the two things you are paying for !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fantastic location, friendly staff, will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachiet
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this travelodge a year ago and rebooked for this summer for 6 nights. After reading some of the reviews on the site we were wondering what had happened to this hotel since we had last stayed and were worried about what we were going to find. We had heard from a relative that at least three cars had had their windscreens smashed when they stayed in January and were thinking about cancelling altogether however, you can not find a hotel for even double what we paid. Â£29 per night for the rooms (we had two as we have three children) and Â£6.75 per Adult breakfast if you pre book. Children eat free. We requested two rooms next to each other on a high floor and that is exactly what we got. It is true that you get to a certain extent what you pay for. The hotel is tired round the edges. Carpets could do with replacing and when we did use the toilet on the ground floor there was a foisty sort of smell that other reviews have mentioned. However, on Floor 4 it was fine. Our rooms were spacious and very clean. The only fault that I could find were two chewing gum type stains on the carpet in one of the rooms which was not pleasant but just shows the lack of respect with which some guests treat their accomodation! There were fans in our room which was a pleasant surprise. The staff are doing the best they can with what they have to work with and we could not fault the service that we received at all. Very friendly and helpful. We requested extra towels and pillows and we got them. They were then replaced in our room on a daily basis. The towels smelt fresh and the sheets were changed regularly. The rooms were cleaned very well and all the tea/coffee etc restocked. Breakfast was not the Hilton but by far the best we have had in any travelodge. The hotel was extremely busy but everything was always available food wise; some times there was a queue to be seated and a short wait for clean mugs/ plates etc but service was always perfect despite the stress of coping with lots of hungry customers. We had dinner two nights too and this was ok for the money. The car park now seems to be manned 24 hours and the attendants are extremely helpful. There were no incidents that we were aware of and we felt extremely safe in this area. It is at most a five minute stroll to the East India DLR and then perhaps twenty minutes to either Towergate or Bank. For the money this hotel can not be beaten and we would like to say thanks to all the staff for a great stay. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “above average travelodge.”
Reviews.Author: LG123
Reviews.Content: large travelodge with seemingly endless rooms and corridoors check in was good and the room (family size) was large and clean. theres a big restaurant and bar downstairs.big compaired to the other travelodges ive stayed in more like a standard hotel restaurant than a TL. car parking cost Â£5 per 24hrs and getting a car pass was easy as staff were on hand to help.you tend to always know what you will get with a TL and this was no different to other ones ive stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Ok to stay in, but a lot of road noise, if your use to quiet locations.”
Reviews.Author: dont-talk-to-them
Reviews.Content: Normal Travelodge Offering, room fine and clean. Very close to Docklands Light Railway. Only points worth raising is that I could not understand the Security Guard when I had to buzz to get into secure park, took me 3 attempts to understand what he was saying. Next to very busy road, so can be noisy if you are not use to the sound of a busy city, even with the windows closed. Overall though, cannot complain for the price.

Reviews.Title: “needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: poddie29
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to using DLR, great price for hotel but no payphone, no cashpoint , towels smelled stale ,bathroom smelled of dampness. be prepared if you`ve been to O2 theres nothing to eat if you get back late and nothing in the surrounding area to get anything, at breakfast very slow on filling up food trays. May sound like im moaning but a simple thing like a teaspoon cant be found at breakfast and they offer tea n coffee!!! Staff were very friendly and helpfull. overall we had a great time and if your not as fussy as me then its go fot it.

Reviews.Title: “By far the nicest Travelodge I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly5665
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night when going to concert at 02. It is in a really great position for the 02 just need to cross the river either on tube or in our case, as Jubilee line was down, on free boat provided by DLR, port in short walking distance from hotel. As for the hotel itself, I was very impressed. The staff were friendly and helpful; the room was a good size and very clean as was the bathroom; the shower was good and powerful (there's nothing I hate more than a bad shower in a hotel!); was lovely to be able to have breakfast at a travelodge and buffet was good for price, particularly as was all you can eat! Parking was good and always a bonus in a London hotel! Only Â£5 for 24 hours. Would definitely stay here again on my next visit to the 02!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - especially for the O2”
Reviews.Author: DanDaMan83
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in London. Stayed in the Travelodge Docklands because it was close to the O2 arena. Hotel is fantastic for the price you pay. Rooms are basic but clean and a good size. Staff were always accomodating; our first key didn't open the door and that was sorted straight away and we were given extra towles when we requested. The bar is very good, food is basic but does the trick. We paid 7.50 each for breakfast which was okay but doin't know if I'd get it again if I went back. The hotel is also very close to the East India train stop to get into the centre of London which is quite far away. But for the O2 it's spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: djedwardsmith
Reviews.Content: Slight queue for check in but enough staff on hand to cope. At first door card didn't work but that was quickly rectified. The room was tidy, on the small side but was easily adequate for an overnight stay. 10 minute drive to the O2, but in rush hour give yourself half hour at least. Adequate parking, nice bar in the evenings. Only gripe would be the poor breakfast. Poor selection and not of the highest quality.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Stay”
Reviews.Author: chilleruk
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at this travelodge and again it did what it said on the tin, cheap clean accommodation with good transport links. We now avoid this lodge at the weekends or when there is something on at the O2. The noise is just horrendous at nights. We were again on the ground floor and worryingly as we walked up the corridor behind reception we again smelt dampness, this was also evident during our last stay in the same corridor. This time the carpets were dry. Our room was ready on our arrival just after 3pm, no waiting to check in. The room was clean but with scuff marks on the walls. The tv remote was missing and a bulb out in the shower room. We reported both on our way out, we received the remote but the bulb wasnt replaced, which was disappointing, it was only a light bulb afterall. The one thing that really annoys me about this lodge is that it has a good bar which is only opened limited hours. It's something like 5pm to 11pm Monday through Thursday and open till midnight I believe Friday and Saturday. When the place is busy and you have people waiting outside the reception wouldnt it make sense to open the bar, people can sit there and you may even make additional Â£Â£Â£!! If you go to a show in the west end, the earliest possible time you can get back to the lodge is 11.15pm, so when you get in you can't have an alcoholic drink. The lodge isnt really near any bars for a convenient drink, so we bring things back or have a drink before heading back to the lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go again”
Reviews.Author: information12
Reviews.Content: We arrived late (10pm) and were absolutely shattered after a 4 and a half hour drive so when I pulled back the covers to find a ripped sheet I was not best pleased but as it was so late we thought there would be no-one to change it so covered it with a pillow for the night (rip was right by the head). The next morning we went down to reception and asked for the sheet to be changed, what looked like a manager was on the same side of reception desk as us and advised the reception staff that although we'd only been there one night it should be changed as it should never have been put on when ripped, we went out for the day returned at 10pm to find sheet had not been changed, I was so annoyed as we had been told it would be done that despite the time we went down to reception to complain. The result?! We were given a sheet to put on the bed ourselves, we do not work for travelodge!! If there are no specific cleaners then another member of staff should have changed the sheet!! The first night we had a towel each but the following day one towel had been removed so we had to share a towel, we were miles from reception and 3 floors up so by the time we waited for the lift and walked a mile of corridor (there was no phone) and queued at the reception desk we could have been out for the day and so we did not request another towel. On the final day I wiped my face with a 'cleanly' provided hand towel to discover it was covered in bright pink lipstick at least I think it was lipstick, I'm sure I don't have to tell you how disgusted that made me feel. Overall an awful stay as the cleaners obviously don't give a damn. The only plus was the location, for the price it wasnt too far from the centre by DLR and tube.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: malteser
Reviews.Content: Had it not been for the engineering works on the Jubilee line on Easter weekend, our stay at the Docklands Travelodge would have been so much less tiring. Not that Travelodge are to blame, but the time taken to central London without the Jubilee line becomes annoying. Otherwise, the staff do their utmost to keep clients happy, the rooms are spacious enough and clean. The restaurant serves basic cheap food. Cons: staff seem to struggle to cope at breakfast, plates could be cleaner sometimes, noise from the road can be a nuisance with the window open. Otherwise this was another pleasant stay at yet another Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “OK (ISH!)”
Reviews.Author: frilly2009
Reviews.Content: Good Points - Easy to get into London via DLR East India a 2 minutes walk away. Can Park for Â£5 a night which is good value for London Outside of Congestion Zones Bad Points - Rooms smell badly of toilets. You get used to it after a while but when you first return to your room is always smells like somebody has just been to the toilet! Horrible showers because the mouldy shower curtains stick to you whilst you are having a shower. The water goes freezing cold then boiling hot! Other peoples hairs hanging off wall tiles to bathrooms! Carpets are rather disgusting, especially in the main coridoors the coridoors SMELL AWFUL! Noisey outside due to planes overhead and some kind of generator going all day and night For Â£19 a room cant complain but I wouldnt pay anymore. Apparently the hotel has just been 'done up'...but it doesnt look or smell like it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the o2”
Reviews.Author: Hannah2307
Reviews.Content: Great value for money hotel, rooms were clean and comfortable, good shower! ideal for the o2 arena. Very helpful staff, additional room items readily available, plenty of reasonably priced parking (Â£5 for 24hrs for residents). Good breakfast plenty of choice and nowhere else nearby to eat. Only improvement would be a cash point in hotel and maybe extended bar times as was shut by the time returned from o2 when would've been nice to have a night cap!! Thanks alot, will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: iluvthecubs
Reviews.Content: Check in took forever.....rooms were adequate as was breakfast. good location, close to public transportation. Probably would not choose it again if given a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Aufweidersein Pets Day Out”
Reviews.Author: babeBabeInTheCity
Reviews.Content: Stayed in London whilst working at the excel exhibition. Not impressed. Assume there are so many people attending the nearby exhibition that they dont need to worry about customer satisfaction, however in these recessionary times they should think again. The corridor was being painting whilst we were there and the fumes were awful , so much so that I awoke with a really bad throat. The cast from aufweidersein pet were there to greet me from 8am as they were painting the room oppposite as loudly as poss. the reception were not bothered and certainly I would only stay here as a last resort in future

Reviews.Title: “Bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: acjkt
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at Â£29 per night which I thought was a bargain, it takes about 20 mins from Central London by DLR which may be a bit far out for some but is not so bad as its quite a good service. The hotel is undergoing refurbisment and that may cause a bit of disturbance to some but most of the work is going on in the day so you probably wouldn't notice it. The breakfast was okay, nice breakfast room and attentive staff, although the scrambled eggs were akin to rubber. If you are arriving by tube/DLR to East India station, there is little signage and late at night it is very deserted so make sure you cross the footbridge (signpost Town Hall), go down the stairs past the buses that are parked and through what looks like a security gate, you will then see the travelodge on the right hand side. I would happily stay again given the cost, even at full price it never seems to go over Â£55 which for London is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “gr8 location 4 th o2 - typical travelodge value”
Reviews.Author: werrie
Reviews.Content: typical travelodge. so close to the o2. good value for money. and yummy breakfast too. what more can one say.

Reviews.Title: “Great for O2”
Reviews.Author: Alex007babe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we were going to the O2 Arena. I looked everywhere to get a good deal and somewhere close. Last year i stayed in the Holiday Inn but this hotel was a much better location, right in the financial times area of the docklands so quite secure if a group of girls or on own. East India DLR is right behind the hotel. Take this to to next tube station and change to get to O2 arena Â£5.60 day pas for zone 1 & 2. Hotel not the ritz but you get what you pay for. Parking is Â£5 for 24hrs. Best hotel for O2 though

Reviews.Title: “Some pros some cons”
Reviews.Author: buxton2006
Reviews.Content: Think we got what we paid for here. The staff were nice and very helpful. The corriders smelt stale and there were holes in the walls. Our room itself was ok, the bathroom could have been cleaner, and our towels disappeared the following day. The shower was powerful though the water was a lot cooler the following day. On the plus side we didn't experience any noise from outside the bed was very comfortable and clean, the car park was cheap and safe. East India DLR was a short walk away. For me the pros outweighed the cons. I would stay here again as it was easy to drive to and was on the whole OK.

Reviews.Title: “Poor example of a Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: simonp820
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night whilst visiting East Lond attraction before flying out of Gatwick. General note: Travelodge's 'jobsworth' policy of not allowing any check-in before 3pm unless you pay a tenner is really putting my off this chain. Large hotel next to main road and business district. Woken by City airport planes at 6.50am - double glazing neither use nor ornament. Rooms very small, bathrooms even smaller. Room wasn't the cleanest I'd seen and equipment was dated.
